complications: A severe lung condition that causes a low amount of oxygen to go through your bloodstream to your organs (acute respiratory distress syndrome)

name: Adult ADHD
description: This mental health disorder includes a combination of persistent problems, such as difficulty paying attention, hyperactivity and impulsive behavior.
symptoms: Problems following through and completing tasks
risks: You have blood relatives, such as a parent or sibling, with ADHD or another mental health disorder
Your mother smoked, drank alcohol or used drugs during pregnancy
As a child, you were exposed to environmental toxins — such as lead, found mainly in paint and pipes in older buildings
complications: Frequent car accidents or other accidents
diagnosis: ADHD rating scales or psychological tests

name: Frontotemporal dementia
description: Read more about this less common type of dementia that can lead to personality changes, speech difficulties and movement problems.

name: Truncus arteriosus
description: Learn more about this congenital heart defect that makes it difficult for the heart to pump the right amount of blood to the lungs and the body.
symptoms: Blue or gray skin due to low oxygen levels.
complications: High blood pressure in the lungs also called pulmonary hypertension
preventions: Talk to your provider about your medicines

name: Low sex drive in women
description: Many women experience a low sex drive at some point. But you can get your desire back. Learn about the diagnosis and treatment of lost libido in women.
symptoms: Having no interest in any type of sexual activity, including masturbation
Never or only seldom having sexual fantasies or thoughts
Being concerned by your lack of sexual activity or fantasies

name: Adult Still's disease
description: Adult Still's disease — Comprehensive overview covers symptoms, complications, treatment of this inflammatory disorder.

name: COVID-19-associated MIS-C
commonNames: COVID-19-associated multisystem inflammatory syndrome in children
description: Learn about symptoms of MIS-C, a serious condition linked to coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). Get help fast if your child shows any signs.
symptoms: Either had COVID-19 or has a close contact who had COVID-19 in the 2 months before hospitalization.
Has a blood test result that shows a high level of inflammation throughout the body, called systemic inflammation.
Has at least two of the following symptoms:
Redness or swelling of the lips and tongue.
Redness or swelling of the hands or feet.
Pain in the belly, vomiting or diarrhea.
preventions: Avoid close contact with anyone who is sick
In public indoor spaces keep distance between yourself and others
When COVID19 community levels are high wear a face mask in public indoor places
Avoid touching your nose eyes and mouth
Cover your mouth with a tissue or your elbow when you sneeze or cough
Clean and disinfect hightouch surfaces regularly
diagnosis: Lab tests, such as blood and urine tests, including tests for the level of an inflammatory protein in the blood.
Imaging tests, such as a chest X-ray, an echocardiogram, an abdominal ultrasound or a CT scan.
treatment: Fluids, if levels are too low, a condition called dehydration.
Blood pressure medicines to treat low blood pressure related to shock or to help with heart function.
A breathing machine called a ventilator.
Medicines that lower the risk of blood clots, such as aspirin or heparin.
In very rare cases, extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) using a machine that does the work of the heart and lungs.

name: Pelvic inflammatory disease
description: This serious infection of the female reproductive organs can cause long-term complications such as infertility and chronic pain. Know the symptoms and causes.
symptoms: Pain — ranging from mild to severe — in your lower abdomen and pelvis
Unusual or heavy vaginal discharge that may have an unpleasant odor
Unusual bleeding from the vagina, especially during or after sex, or between periods
risks: Being sexually active and younger than 25 years old
Being in a sexual relationship with someone who has more than one sex partner
Douching regularly, which upsets the balance of good versus harmful bacteria in the vagina and might mask symptoms
Having a history of pelvic inflammatory disease or a sexually transmitted infection
preventions: Talk to your health care provider about contraception
Request that your partner be tested

name: Illness anxiety disorder
description: Excessive worry that you're seriously ill based on minor symptoms can result in major emotional distress and disrupt your life. Also called hypochondria.
symptoms: Being preoccupied with having or getting a serious disease or health condition
Worrying that minor symptoms or body sensations mean you have a serious illness
Being easily alarmed about your health status
Finding little or no reassurance from doctor visits or negative test results
Worrying excessively about a specific medical condition or your risk of developing a medical condition because it runs in your family
Having so much distress about possible illnesses that it's hard for you to function
Repeatedly checking your body for signs of illness or disease
Frequently making medical appointments for reassurance — or avoiding medical care for fear of being diagnosed with a serious illness
Avoiding people, places or activities for fear of health risks
Constantly talking about your health and possible illnesses
Frequently searching the internet for causes of symptoms or possible illnesses
risks: A time of major life stress
Threat of a serious illness that turns out not to be serious
History of abuse as a child
A serious childhood illness or a parent with a serious illness
Personality traits, such as having a tendency toward being a worrier
complications: Relationship or family problems because excessive worrying can frustrate others
Work-related performance problems or excessive absences
Problems functioning in daily life, possibly even resulting in disability
Financial problems due to excessive health care visits and medical bills
Having another mental health disorder, such as somatic symptom disorder, other anxiety disorders, depression or a personality disorder
preventions: If you have problems with anxiety seek professional advice
Learn to recognize when youre stressed and how this affects your body
diagnosis: Conduct a psychological evaluation to talk about your symptoms, stressful situations, family history, fears or concerns, and ways that your anxiety is negatively affecting your life
Have you fill out a psychological self-assessment or questionnaire
Ask you about alcohol, drug or other substance use
Determine whether your illness preoccupation is better explained by another mental disorder, such as somatic symptom disorder or generalized anxiety disorder.

name: Acute flaccid myelitis
description: Know the possible symptoms of acute flaccid myelitis (AFM), a rare but serious condition that affects young children.
preventions: Wash your hands often with soap and water.
Avoid touching your face with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched surfaces.
Cover coughs and sneezes with a tissue or upper shirt sleeve.

name: Pubic lice infestation
description: Pubic lice (crabs) are an itchy, but treatable, nuisance. Find out how to spot and treat this common sexually transmitted infection (STI).
symptoms: Eyelashes or eyebrows, more commonly in children

name: Tuberculosis
description: Learn about the symptoms, treatment and prevention of this common infectious disease.
complications: Swelling of the membranes that cover your brain meningitis

name: Hemorrhoids
description: There are many effective options for easing the discomfort of hemorrhoids — swollen veins in your anus and lower rectum.
causes: Sitting for long periods of time on the toilet
preventions: Go as soon as you feel the urge

name: Hypoglycemia
description: Low blood sugar can cause uncomfortable symptoms, such as dizziness and confusion, and can quickly become serious if left untreated.
symptoms: Tingling or numbness of the lips, tongue or cheek
diagnosis: What were your signs and symptoms
What is your blood sugar level when youre having symptoms
Do your symptoms disappear when blood sugar levels increase

name: Age spots
description: Learn more about the harmless dark spots on your skin that tend to appear as you age, especially in areas exposed to the sun. Treatment is available.
risks: Have a history of frequent or intense sun exposure or sunburn
preventions: Avoid the sun between 10 am and 2 pm

name: Tuberous sclerosis
description: This uncommon genetic disorder causes tumors that are not cancer. These tumors are unexpected overgrowths of tissue in different parts of the body.
symptoms: Problems in thinking reasoning and learning
risks: A gene change passed down in families
complications: Too much fluid in and around the brain

name: Cradle cap
description: Learn about the symptoms, treatments and home care tips for this short-lived type of seborrheic dermatitis that's common in infants.
symptoms: Patchy scaling or thick crusts on the scalp
Oily or dry skin covered with flaky white or yellow scales

name: Diabetic hypoglycemia
description: Low blood sugar can make you feel awful and is potentially dangerous. Learn about low blood sugar symptoms and treatments for someone with diabetes.
causes: Taking too much insulin or diabetes medication
Postponing or skipping a meal or snack
Increasing exercise or physical activity without eating more or adjusting your medications
risks: People taking diabetes drugs called sulfonylureas, such as glipizide (Glucotrol), glimepiride (Amaryl) or glyburide (Diabeta, Glynase)
Those with impaired liver or kidney function
People who've had diabetes for a long time
People who don't feel low blood sugar symptoms (hypoglycemia unawareness)
Anyone with a disability that prevents a quick response to falling blood sugar levels
preventions: Dont skip or delay meals or snacks
Measure medication carefully and take it on time
Adjust your medication or eat additional snacks if you increase your physical activity
Eat a meal or snack with alcohol if you choose to drink
Carry some form of diabetes identification so that in an emergency others will know that you have diabetes

name: Pilonidal cyst
description: Learn about causes, symptoms and treatments of this painful condition that usually affects the skin above the tailbone in people who sit for long periods.
symptoms: A pit near the top of the buttocks crease.
Pus or blood leaking from an opening in the skin.
risks: Being a young adult white male.
Sitting for long periods at a time.
preventions: Achieve or maintain a healthy weight.

name: Dry macular degeneration
description: Blurred or reduced central vision could be a sign of macular degeneration. Find out about symptoms and treatment for this common eye disorder.
symptoms: Visual distortions, such as straight lines seeming bent.
Reduced central vision in one or both eyes.
The need for brighter light when reading or doing close-up work.
Increased difficulty adapting to low light levels, such as when entering a dimly lit restaurant or theater.
A well-defined blurry spot or blind spot in the field of vision.
preventions: Maintain a healthy weight and exercise regularly
Choose a diet rich in fruits and vegetables

name: Muscle cramp
description: Muscle cramp — Comprehensive overview covers causes, treatment, prevention of cramped muscles.

name: Salivary gland tumor
description: Learn about this rare tumor that forms in the salivary glands. Treatments include surgery and radiation therapy.
symptoms: A lump or swelling on or near your jaw or in your neck or mouth
Numbness in part of your face
Muscle weakness on one side of your face
Persistent pain in the area of a salivary gland
diagnosis: Collecting of a sample of tissue for testing biopsy

name: Dehydration
description: Dehydration is especially common and dangerous for infants, young children and older adults. Learn more about treating and preventing dehydration.
risks: People who work or exercise outside
complications: Low blood volume shock hypovolemic shock

name: Sacral dimple
description: Learn about the causes, complications and diagnosis of this indentation on the lower back present at birth in some babies.

name: Menstrual cramps
description: Menstrual cramps — pain in the lower abdomen just before or during menstrual periods — can range from mild to severe. Learn about treatment options.
symptoms: Throbbing or cramping pain in your lower abdomen that can be intense
Pain that starts 1 to 3 days before your period, peaks 24 hours after the onset of your period and subsides in 2 to 3 days
Pain that radiates to your lower back and thighs
risks: You started puberty early, at age 11 or younger
You have a family history of menstrual cramps (dysmenorrhea)

name: Wet macular degeneration
description: Blurred vision or blind spots could be a sign of this chronic eye disorder. Recognizing the warning signs could save your vision.
symptoms: Visual distortions, such as straight lines seeming bent.
Reduced central vision in one or both eyes.
The need for brighter light when reading or doing close-up work.
Difficulty adjusting to low light levels, such as when entering a dimly lit restaurant or theater.
A well-defined blurry spot or blind spot in the field of vision.
preventions: Maintain a healthy weight and exercise regularly
Choose a diet rich in fruits and vegetables

name: Turner syndrome
description: Turner syndrome affects only females as the result of a missing or partially missing X chromosome, causing a variety of medical and developmental problems.

name: Hyponatremia
description: Hyponatremia is the term used when your blood sodium is too low. Learn about symptoms, causes and treatment of this potentially dangerous condition.
symptoms: Loss of energy, drowsiness and fatigue
causes: Syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone SIADH
Chronic severe vomiting or diarrhea and other causes of dehydration
risks: Conditions that decrease your bodys water excretion
preventions: Consider drinking sports beverages during demanding activities

name: Giant cell arteritis
description: Head pain and tenderness are the most common symptoms of giant cell arteritis, an inflammation of the lining of your arteries.

name: Acne
description: Learn more about this common skin condition, including causes, treatments and simple skin care steps you can do at home to help control it.
risks: Friction or pressure on your skin
treatment: Avoid scarring or other damage to your skin

name: Myelofibrosis
description: Find out more about this bone marrow cancer. Learn about symptoms, diagnosis and treatments for primary myelofibrosis and secondary myelofibrosis.
symptoms: Feeling tired, weak or short of breath, usually because of anemia
Pain or fullness below your ribs on the left side, due to an enlarged spleen
complications: Increased pressure on blood flowing into your liver
Growths in other areas of your body
treatment: Surgical removal of the spleen splenectomy

name: Ruptured eardrum
description: A ruptured eardrum is a hole or tear in your eardrum, the thin tissue that separates your ear canal from your middle ear.
symptoms: Ear pain that may subside quickly
Mucuslike, pus-filled or bloody drainage from the ear
Nausea or vomiting that can result from vertigo
preventions: Get treatment for middle ear infections
Keep your ears free of foreign objects

name: Hypoparathyroidism
description: Learn more about this uncommon condition in which low levels of parathyroid hormone upsets the balance of calcium and phosphorus in your body.
symptoms: Tingling or burning in the fingertips, toes and lips
Muscle aches or cramps in the legs, feet, stomach or face
Twitching or spasms of muscles, particularly around the mouth, but also in the hands, arms and throat
risks: Recent neck surgery, particularly if the thyroid was involved
Having certain autoimmune or endocrine conditions, such as Addison's disease — which causes a decrease in the hormones the adrenal glands produce

name: Craniopharyngioma
description: Learn more about this noncancerous tumor that forms near the brain's pituitary gland, including diagnosis and treatment options.
diagnosis: Collecting and testing a sample of abnormal tissue biopsy

name: Pinched nerve
description: Pressure on a nerve can lead to numbness, tingling or pain that’s often improved by resting the area.
symptoms: Numbness or decreased sensation in the area supplied by the nerve
Sharp, aching or burning pain, which may radiate outward
Muscle weakness in the affected area
Frequent feeling that a foot or hand has "fallen asleep"
preventions: Maintain good positioning — don't cross your legs or lie in any one position for a long time.
Incorporate strength and flexibility exercises into your regular exercise program.
Limit repetitive activities and take frequent breaks when engaging in these activities.

name: Agoraphobia
description: Agoraphobia is an anxiety disorder in which you fear and avoid public places or situations where you might feel panicked, trapped, helpless or embarrassed.
symptoms: Enclosed spaces, such as movie theaters, elevators or small stores.
Open spaces, such as parking lots, bridges or malls.
Using public transportation, such as a bus, plane or train.
risks: Having panic disorder or other excessive fear reactions, called phobias.
Responding to panic attacks with too much fear and avoidance.
Experiencing stressful life events, such as abuse, the death of a parent or being attacked.
Having an anxious or nervous personality.
Having a blood relative with agoraphobia.
diagnosis: In-depth interview with your health care provider or a mental health provider.
Physical exam to rule out other conditions that could be causing your symptoms.

name: Craniosynostosis
description: This condition results in premature fusing of one or more of the joints between the bone plates of an infant's skull before the brain is fully formed.
symptoms: A misshapen skull, with the shape depending on which of the sutures are affected
Development of a raised, hard ridge along affected sutures, with a change in the shape of the head that's not typical

name: Hypopituitarism
description: Learn about the symptoms and treatment of this rare hormonal disorder caused by a problem with the pituitary gland.
causes: Radiation treatment to the head or neck
Lack of blood flow to the brain or pituitary gland (stroke) or bleeding (hemorrhage) into the brain or pituitary gland
Certain medications, such as narcotics, high-dose corticosteroids or certain cancer drugs called checkpoint inhibitors
Inflammation of the pituitary gland caused by an abnormal immune system response (hypophysitis)
Infections of the brain, such as meningitis, or infections that can spread to the brain, such as tuberculosis or syphilis

Infiltrative diseases, which affect multiple parts of the body, including sarcoidosis, an inflammatory disease occurring in various organs; Langerhans cell histiocytosis, in which abnormal cells cause scarring in numerous parts of the body; and hemochromatosis, which causes excess iron deposits in the liver and other tissues
Severe loss of blood during childbirth, which may cause damage to the front part of the pituitary gland (Sheehan's syndrome or postpartum pituitary necrosis)

name: Type 1 diabetes
description: Learn about the symptoms, causes, treatment of this chronic condition in which the pancreas produces little or no insulin.
symptoms: Bed-wetting in children who have never wet the bed during the night
Feeling irritable or having other mood changes
causes: Exposure to viruses and other environmental factors
treatment: Exercising regularly and keeping a healthy weight

name: Creutzfeldt Jakob disease
description: Learn what can put someone at risk of developing this rare brain disorder that causes dementia.

name: Pineoblastoma
description: Learn about this rare cancer that begins in the brain's pineal gland. Treatments include surgery, radiation therapy and chemotherapy.
diagnosis: Collecting and testing a sample of abnormal tissue biopsy

name: Guillain Barre syndrome
description: This rare autoimmune disorder affects the nerves, causing weakness and tingling in the arms and legs that rapidly spreads throughout the body.
symptoms: A pins and needles sensation in your fingers, toes, ankles or wrists
Weakness in your legs that spreads to your upper body
Unsteady walking or inability to walk or climb stairs
Difficulty with facial movements, including speaking, chewing or swallowing
Double vision or inability to move the eyes
Severe pain that may feel achy, shooting or cramplike and may be worse at night
Difficulty with bladder control or bowel function
risks: Most commonly, infection with campylobacter, a type of bacteria often found in undercooked poultry
Hepatitis A, B, C and E
HIV, the virus that causes AIDS
Rarely, influenza vaccinations or childhood vaccinations
COVID-19 Johnson & Johnson and AstraZeneca vaccine

name: Hypoplastic left heart syndrome
description: Learn more about this rare congenital heart condition that results in underdevelopment of the left side of the heart.
symptoms: Grayish-blue color of the lips and gums (cyanosis)
complications: Tiring easily during sports or other exercise
Fluid buildup in the lungs, abdomen, legs and feet (edema)
Developing blood clots that may lead to a pulmonary embolism or stroke
Developmental problems related to the brain and nervous system
Need for additional heart surgery or a heart transplant

name: Type 1 diabetes in children
description: Know what symptoms to look for, as well as more about diagnosis, treatment and daily living with this lifelong insulin-dependent condition.
symptoms: Frequent urination, possibly bed-wetting in a toilet-trained child
preventions: Preventing or delaying the start of type 1 diabetes in people who have a high risk of the disease.
Preventing further destruction of the islet cells in people who are newly diagnosed.

name: Sudden infant death syndrome
description: Learn about possible causes, risks and prevention of the sudden unexplained death of a seemingly healthy baby in the first year of life.
preventions: Keep the crib as bare as possible
Have your baby sleep in in your room
Dont use baby monitors and other commercial devices that claim to reduce the risk of SIDS

name: Pink eye
description: This highly contagious eye condition can be itchy and uncomfortable. But much like the common cold, it rarely requires medicine or staying home.
symptoms: Redness in one or both eyes.
Itchiness in one or both eyes.
A gritty feeling in one or both eyes.
A discharge in one or both eyes that forms a crust during the night that may prevent your eye or eyes from opening in the morning.
causes: A chemical splash in the eye.
A foreign object in the eye.
In newborns, a blocked tear duct.
risks: Exposure to someone infected with the viral or bacterial form of conjunctivitis.
Exposure to something you're allergic to, for allergic conjunctivitis.
Using contact lenses, especially extended-wear lenses.
complications: A feeling that something is stuck in your eye.
diagnosis: A foreign body in your eye.

name: HIV/AIDS
description: Learn more about this potentially life-threatening infection that spreads through blood, sex and childbirth. Know how to prevent and treat it.
preventions: Use postexposure prophylaxis PEP if youve been exposed to HIV
Use a new condom every time you have sex
Tell your sexual partners if you have HIV
If youre pregnant get medical care right away

name: Type 2 diabetes
description: High blood sugar levels are the key problem in diabetes. Learn about lifestyle changes to lower your risk and treatments to manage diabetes.
symptoms: Numbness or tingling in the hands or feet
Areas of darkened skin, usually in the armpits and neck
causes: Cells in muscle, fat and the liver become resistant to insulin. Because these cells don't interact in a normal way with insulin, they don't take in enough sugar.
The pancreas is unable to produce enough insulin to manage blood sugar levels.
risks: Areas of darkened skin usually in the armpits and neck
diagnosis: 6.5% or higher on two separate tests indicates diabetes.
treatment: Possibly, diabetes medication or insulin therapy

name: Crohn's disease
description: Learn about symptoms and treatment for this debilitating, but treatable, digestive condition.
symptoms: Pain or drainage near or around the anus due to inflammation from a tunnel into the skin (fistula)

name: Pinworm infestation
description: Learn more about the symptoms, treatment and prevention of this common type of intestinal worm infection.
symptoms: Itching of the anal or vaginal area
Insomnia, irritability, teeth grinding and restlessness
complications: Infection of part of the abdomen (peritoneal cavity)

name: Airplane ear
description: That fullness in your ear when on an airplane that's climbing or descending results from uneven air pressure between your middle ear and the environment.
symptoms: Moderate discomfort or pain in your ear
Feeling of fullness or stuffiness in your ear
Muffled hearing or slight to moderate hearing loss
risks: A small eustachian tube, especially in infants and toddlers
Sleeping on an airplane during ascent and descent because you aren't actively doing things to equalize pressure in your ears such as yawning or swallowing

name: Hypospadias
description: Hypospadias is a birth defect in which the opening of the urethra is located on the underside of the penis instead of the tip. Learn about treatment.
symptoms: Opening of the urethra at a location other than the tip of the penis
Hooded appearance of the penis because only the top half of the penis is covered by foreskin
risks: Exposure to certain substances during pregnancy
complications: Problems learning to use a toilet
Abnormal curvature of the penis with erection

name: Type 2 diabetes in children
description: More children are being diagnosed with this blood sugar condition. Learn how to help manage or prevent this chronic disease in your child.
symptoms: Darkened areas of skin, most often around the neck or in the armpits and groin
Unintended weight loss, although this is less common in children with type 2 diabetes than in children with type 1 diabetes
causes: The pancreas may not make enough insulin
The cells become resistant to insulin and don't allow as much sugar in
risks: Low birth weight or preterm birth

name: Hypopituitarism
description: Learn about the symptoms and treatment of this rare hormonal disorder caused by a problem with the pituitary gland.
causes: Radiation treatment to the head or neck
Lack of blood flow to the brain or pituitary gland (stroke) or bleeding (hemorrhage) into the brain or pituitary gland
Certain medications, such as narcotics, high-dose corticosteroids or certain cancer drugs called checkpoint inhibitors
Inflammation of the pituitary gland caused by an abnormal immune system response (hypophysitis)
Infections of the brain, such as meningitis, or infections that can spread to the brain, such as tuberculosis or syphilis

Infiltrative diseases, which affect multiple parts of the body, including sarcoidosis, an inflammatory disease occurring in various organs; Langerhans cell histiocytosis, in which abnormal cells cause scarring in numerous parts of the body; and hemochromatosis, which causes excess iron deposits in the liver and other tissues
Severe loss of blood during childbirth, which may cause damage to the front part of the pituitary gland (Sheehan's syndrome or postpartum pituitary necrosis)

name: Croup
description: This upper airway infection makes it harder to breathe and causes a barking cough. It involves swelling around the voice box, windpipe and bronchial tubes.
symptoms: Loud barking cough that's made worse by crying and coughing, as well as anxiety and distress, setting up a cycle of worsening symptoms.
preventions: Frequent hand-washing with soap and water for at least 20 seconds is the most important step.
Keep your child away from anyone who's sick.
Encourage your child to cough or sneeze into the elbow.
diagnosis: Listens to your child's chest with a stethoscope.

name: Albinism
description: In this group of inherited disorders, the body makes little or no melanin, a pigment that determines hair, skin and eye color and vision development.
diagnosis: A physical exam that includes checking skin and hair pigmentation.
Comparison of your child's pigmentation to that of other family members.
Review of your child's medical history, including whether there has been bleeding that doesn't stop, frequent or large bruises, or unexpected infections.
treatment: Skin care and prevention of skin cancer

name: Typhoid fever
description: Learn more about the symptoms, cause and treatment of this serious bacterial infection.
risks: Work in or travel to areas where typhoid fever is established, especially if you travel to visit family or friends. People visiting loved ones may have higher social pressure to drink or eat foods that present a higher risk.
Work as a clinical microbiologist handling Salmonella enterica serotype typhi bacteria.
Have close contact with someone who is infected or has recently been infected with typhoid fever.

name: Complex regional pain syndrome
description: Learn about this neurological condition that may affect an arm or a leg after an injury or surgery. Early treatment may prevent a recurrence.
symptoms: Continuous burning or throbbing pain, usually in the arm, leg, hand or foot
Changes in skin temperature — alternating between sweaty and cold
Changes in skin color, ranging from white and blotchy to red or blue
Changes in skin texture, which may become tender, thin or shiny in the affected area
Changes in hair and nail growth
Decreased ability to move the affected body part
preventions: Taking vitamin C after a wrist fracture

name: Low blood pressure
description: Low blood pressure isn't always a concern. But sometimes hypotension can cause dizziness and fainting or be life-threatening. Learn when it's treated.

name: Pituitary tumor
description: Learn more about the symptoms, causes and treatment of growths that develop in the pituitary gland.
risks: Multiple endocrine neoplasia, type 1, also called MEN 1.
Multiple endocrine neoplasia, type 4, also called MEN 4.
complications: Problems with eyesight, including vision loss.

name: Alcohol use disorder
description: Unhealthy alcohol use ranges from mild to severe, including alcoholism and binge drinking, putting health and safety at risk. Early treatment is important.
symptoms: Being unable to limit the amount of alcohol you drink
Wanting to cut down on how much you drink or making unsuccessful attempts to do so
Spending a lot of time drinking, getting alcohol or recovering from alcohol use
Feeling a strong craving or urge to drink alcohol
Failing to fulfill major obligations at work, school or home due to repeated alcohol use
Continuing to drink alcohol even though you know it's causing physical, social, work or relationship problems
Giving up or reducing social and work activities and hobbies to use alcohol
Using alcohol in situations where it's not safe, such as when driving or swimming
Developing a tolerance to alcohol so you need more to feel its effect or you have a reduced effect from the same amount
Experiencing withdrawal symptoms — such as nausea, sweating and shaking — when you don't drink, or drinking to avoid these symptoms
risks: Depression and other mental health problems
preventions: Loss of interest in activities and hobbies and in personal appearance
Red eyes, slurred speech, problems with coordination and memory lapses
Difficulties or changes in relationships with friends, such as joining a new crowd
Declining grades and problems in school
Frequent mood changes and defensive behavior
diagnosis: Ask you some questions related to your drinking habits
Suggest lab tests and imaging tests
treatment: Learning new skills and making a treatment plan

name: Canker sores
description: Canker sore — Learn about the causes, treatment and prevention of this painful mouth sore.
causes: A minor injury to your mouth from dental work, overzealous brushing, sports mishaps or an accidental cheek bite
Toothpastes and mouth rinses containing sodium lauryl sulfate
Food sensitivities, particularly to chocolate, coffee, strawberries, eggs, nuts, cheese, and spicy or acidic foods
A diet lacking in vitamin B-12, zinc, folate (folic acid) or iron
An allergic response to certain bacteria in your mouth
Helicobacter pylori, the same bacteria that cause peptic ulcers

name: Cryoglobulinemia
description: When abnormal proteins in your blood clump together at temperatures below 98.6 F (37 C), it can block blood flow and damage your skin, joints and nerves.

name: Pityriasis rosea
description: Learn more about the symptoms, causes and treatment of this large rash common among teens and young adults.
complications: Temporary spots (lasting weeks to months) of skin that are darker or lighter than usual (post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation or hypopigmentation), which is more likely in people with brown or Black skin

name: Alcohol intolerance
description: Having an immediate reaction after drinking alcohol, such as a stuffy nose and skin flushing, might indicate alcohol intolerance.
causes: Histamine, a byproduct of fermentation or brewing
risks: Having asthma or hay fever (allergic rhinitis)
Having an allergy to grains or to another food

name: Peptic ulcer
description: Feeling a dull or burning pain in your stomach? It could be a peptic ulcer — a common, treatable digestive condition. Find out more.
symptoms: Feeling of fullness, bloating or belching
causes: Regular use of certain pain relievers
complications: A hole perforation in your stomach wall
treatment: Antibiotic medications to kill H pylori
Medications that block acid production and promote healing
Medications that protect the lining of your stomach and small intestine

name: Hypothermia
description: Learn about symptoms, treatment and prevention of hypothermia — a life-threatening condition in which the body loses heat faster than it can generate it.
causes: Wearing clothes that aren't warm enough for weather conditions
Staying out in the cold too long
Being unable to get out of wet clothes or move to a warm, dry location
Falling into the water, as in a boating accident
Living in a house that's too cold, either from poor heating or too much air conditioning
complications: Decay and death of tissue resulting from an interruption in blood flow (gangrene)

name: Undescended testicle
description: Learn about causes, complications and treatment of this condition in which one or both testicles aren't in their normal place within the scrotum.
risks: Family history of undescended testicles or other problems of genital development
Conditions of the fetus that can restrict growth, such as Down syndrome or an abdominal wall defect
Alcohol use by the mother during pregnancy
Cigarette smoking by the mother or exposure to secondhand smoke

name: Tinea versicolor
description: Learn about the symptoms, causes, treatments of this common skin infection that usually responds to treatment.
symptoms: Patches of skin discoloration, usually on the back, chest, neck and upper arms, which may appear lighter or darker than usual
preventions: Selenium sulfide (Selsun) 2.5 percent lotion or shampoo
Ketoconazole (Ketoconazole, Nizoral, others) cream, gel or shampoo
Itraconazole (Onmel, Sporanox) tablets, capsules or oral solution
treatment: Ketoconazole (Ketoconazole, Nizoral, others) cream, gel or shampoo
Ciclopirox (Loprox, Penlac) cream, gel or shampoo
Itraconazole (Onmel, Sporanox) tablets, capsules or oral solution
Selenium sulfide (Selsun) 2.5 percent lotion or shampoo

name: Alcohol poisoning
description: Alcohol poisoning is a serious and sometimes deadly consequence of drinking large amounts of alcohol in a short time. Here's what to do in an emergency.
symptoms: Slow breathing (less than eight breaths a minute)
Irregular breathing (a gap of more than 10 seconds between breaths)
Passing out (unconsciousness) and can't be awakened
risks: Whether you're combining alcohol with other drugs
The percentage of alcohol in your drinks
The rate and amount of alcohol consumption
preventions: Drink alcohol in moderation if at all
Dont drink on an empty stomach
treatment: Prevention of breathing or choking problems
Fluids given through a vein (intravenously) to prevent dehydration
Use of vitamins and glucose to help prevent serious complications of alcohol poisoning

name: Solitary rectal ulcer syndrome
description: Solitary rectal ulcer syndrome is a rare condition that's often linked to chronic constipation. Learn more about symptoms and treatment.
symptoms: Pain or a feeling of fullness in your pelvis
A feeling of incomplete passing of stool

name: Hypothyroidism
description: Understand what happens when your thyroid is underactive and learn about treatment for this condition.
risks: Have a family history of thyroid disease.
Have an autoimmune disease, such as type 1 diabetes or celiac disease.
Received radiation to your neck or upper chest.

name: CSF leak
description: Cerebrospinal fluid leaks may originate from the brain or spine, causing headaches, dizziness and other symptoms.
causes: An epidural in the spine for pain relief, such as during labor and delivery
An injury to the head or spine
Abnormalities of the dura mater around the nerve roots in the spine
Abnormal connections between dura mater and veins (CSF-venous fistulas)
risks: Having a previous surgery or procedure on or around the spine
Connective tissue disorders such as Marfan syndrome or Ehlers-Danlos syndrome

name: Polycystic kidney disease
description: Learn how treatments and lifestyle changes might help reduce damage to your kidneys from polycystic kidney disease.
symptoms: A feeling of fullness in your abdomen
Increased size of your abdomen due to enlarged kidneys
complications: Growth of cysts in the liver
Development of an aneurysm in the brain
preventions: Take the blood pressure medications prescribed by your doctor as directed.
Eat a low-salt diet containing plenty of fruits, vegetables and whole grains.
Maintain a healthy weight. Ask your doctor what the right weight is for you.
Exercise regularly. Aim for at least 30 minutes of moderate physical activity most days of the week.

name: Alcohol use disorder
description: Unhealthy alcohol use ranges from mild to severe, including alcoholism and binge drinking, putting health and safety at risk. Early treatment is important.
symptoms: Being unable to limit the amount of alcohol you drink
Wanting to cut down on how much you drink or making unsuccessful attempts to do so
Spending a lot of time drinking, getting alcohol or recovering from alcohol use
Feeling a strong craving or urge to drink alcohol
Failing to fulfill major obligations at work, school or home due to repeated alcohol use
Continuing to drink alcohol even though you know it's causing physical, social, work or relationship problems
Giving up or reducing social and work activities and hobbies to use alcohol
Using alcohol in situations where it's not safe, such as when driving or swimming
Developing a tolerance to alcohol so you need more to feel its effect or you have a reduced effect from the same amount
Experiencing withdrawal symptoms — such as nausea, sweating and shaking — when you don't drink, or drinking to avoid these symptoms
risks: Depression and other mental health problems
preventions: Loss of interest in activities and hobbies and in personal appearance
Red eyes, slurred speech, problems with coordination and memory lapses
Difficulties or changes in relationships with friends, such as joining a new crowd
Declining grades and problems in school
Frequent mood changes and defensive behavior
diagnosis: Ask you some questions related to your drinking habits
Suggest lab tests and imaging tests
treatment: Learning new skills and making a treatment plan

name: Ulcerative colitis
description: This type of inflammatory bowel disease affects the innermost lining of your digestive tract. Learn about available treatments for this often exhausting condition.
symptoms: Diarrhea, often with blood or pus
Rectal bleeding — passing small amount of blood with stool
complications: A rapidly swelling colon, also called a toxic megacolon
A hole in the colon, also called a perforated colon
Increased risk of blood clots in veins and arteries
Inflammation of the skin, joints and eyes
An increased risk of colon cancer

name: Cutaneous t-cell lymphoma
description: Learn about this type of non-Hodgkin's lymphoma that attacks the skin. Find out about cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL) symptoms, diagnosis and treatments.
symptoms: Round patches of skin that may be raised or scaly and might be itchy
Patches of skin that appear lighter in color than surrounding skin
Lumps that form on the skin and may break open
Thickening of the skin on the palms of the hands and soles of the feet
A rash-like skin redness over the entire body that is intensely itchy

name: Inflammatory bowel disease
description: Chronic diarrhea and belly pain could be caused by inflammatory bowel disease. Learn about IBD causes, diagnosis and treatment.

name: Phenylketonuria
description: PKU is caused by a change in the gene that helps create an enzyme needed to break down phenylalanine. Treatment includes a special diet and medication.
symptoms: A musty odor in the breath, skin or urine, caused by too much phenylalanine in the body
Nervous system (neurological) problems that may include seizures
Lighter skin, hair and eye color than family members, because phenylalanine can't transform into melanin — the pigment responsible for hair and skin tone
risks: Having both parents with a gene change that causes PKU
Being of a certain racial or ethnic descent
complications: Irreversible brain damage and marked intellectual disability beginning within the first few months of life
Neurological problems such as seizures and tremors
Behavioral, emotional and social problems in older children and adults
treatment: A lifetime diet with very limited intake of foods with phenylalanine

Taking a PKU formula — a special nutritional supplement — for life to make sure that you get enough essential protein (without phenylalanine) and nutrients that are essential for growth and general health
Medications, for certain people with PKU

name: Ulnar wrist pain
description: Ulnar wrist pain occurs on the side of your wrist opposite your thumb. The pain can become severe enough to prevent you from doing simple tasks.

name: Alcoholic hepatitis
description: Drinking heavily over years can cause inflammation of the liver. If you have alcoholic hepatitis, you must stop drinking.
causes: The body's process for breaking down alcohol produces highly toxic chemicals.
These chemicals trigger inflammation that destroys liver cells.
Over time, scars replace healthy liver tissue, interfering with liver function.
This irreversible scarring (cirrhosis) is the final stage of alcoholic liver disease.
preventions: Drink alcohol in moderation if at all
Check before mixing medications and alcohol

name: Peyronie's disease
description: Understand what causes bent and painful erections, and learn what treatments are available.
symptoms: A significant bend to the penis
complications: Difficulty achieving or maintaining an erection (erectile dysfunction)
Anxiety or stress about sexual abilities or the appearance of your penis
Stress on your relationship with your sexual partner
Difficulty fathering a child, because intercourse is difficult or impossible

name: Placenta accreta
description: During pregnancy, if part of the placenta grows too far into the uterine wall, it can remain attached after childbirth, causing severe maternal blood loss.

name: Ulnar wrist pain
description: Ulnar wrist pain occurs on the side of your wrist opposite your thumb. The pain can become severe enough to prevent you from doing simple tasks.

name: Irritable bowel syndrome
description: Lifestyle changes can make a big difference when it comes to managing this common GI disorder. Learn more about symptoms, diagnosis, and how to avoid triggers for this long-term condition.
symptoms: Abdominal pain, cramping or bloating that is related to passing a bowel movement
Changes in appearance of bowel movement
Changes in how often you are having a bowel movement
risks: Have a family history of IBS
Have anxiety depression or other mental health issues

name: Churg-Strauss syndrome
description: This rare blood vessel disease may cause breathing trouble, face pain and a persistent runny nose. Medications can help.
symptoms: Loss of appetite and weight loss
Weakness, fatigue or a general feeling of being unwell
Pain, numbness, and tingling in your hands and feet

name: Scoliosis
description: This sideways curvature of the spine occurs most often during the growth spurt just before puberty. Treatment may include braces or surgery.
symptoms: One shoulder blade that appears more prominent than the other
One hip higher than the other
One side of the rib cage jutting forward
A prominence on one side of the back when bending forward
causes: Certain neuromuscular conditions, such as cerebral palsy or muscular dystrophy
Birth defects affecting the development of the bones of the spine
Previous surgery on the chest wall as a baby
Injuries to or infections of the spine

name: Placenta previa
description: Learn about how this pregnancy complication is diagnosed and managed to reduce risks to your baby's health and your own.
risks: Have had a previous C-section delivery
Have scars on the uterus from a previous surgery or procedure
Had placenta previa with a previous pregnancy
Are pregnant after having an assisted reproductive technology (ART) procedure for treating infertility
Are carrying more than one fetus
treatment: Sexual intercourse or sexual activity that could lead to orgasm
Standing for long periods of time

name: Umbilical hernia
description: Learn about this condition in which your intestines create a bulge near your navel.
causes: Long-term peritoneal dialysis to treat kidney failure
treatment: Are slightly larger than 1/4 to 3/4 inch (1 to 2 centimeters) in diameter
Are large and don't decrease in size over the first two years of life
Become trapped or block the intestine

name: Idiopathic hypersomnia
description: This is a sleep disorder that causes you to be excessively sleepy during the day and to have trouble waking up from sleep.

name: Churg-Strauss syndrome
description: This rare blood vessel disease may cause breathing trouble, face pain and a persistent runny nose. Medications can help.
symptoms: Loss of appetite and weight loss
Weakness, fatigue or a general feeling of being unwell
Pain, numbness, and tingling in your hands and feet

name: Cushing syndrome
description: High levels of the hormone cortisol in your body cause this endocrine disorder. Learn about symptoms, causes and treatment.
complications: Bone loss (osteoporosis), which can result in unusual bone fractures, such as rib fractures and fractures of the bones in the feet
Loss of muscle mass and strength

name: Placental abruption
description: This uncommon pregnancy complication, in which the placenta separates from the wall of the uterus, can endanger both the mother and the baby.
symptoms: Vaginal bleeding, although there might not be any
Uterine contractions, often coming one right after another
risks: Placental abruption in a previous pregnancy that wasn't caused by abdominal trauma
Hypertension-related problems during pregnancy, including preeclampsia, HELLP syndrome or eclampsia
A fall or other type of blow to the abdomen
Early rupture of membranes, which causes leaking amniotic fluid before the end of pregnancy
Infection inside of the uterus during pregnancy (chorioamnionitis)
complications: The need for a blood transfusion
Failure of the kidneys or other organs resulting from blood loss
Rarely, the need for hysterectomy, if uterine bleeding can't be controlled
treatment: The baby isnt close to full term
The baby is close to full term

name: Pseudobulbar affect
description: Pseudobulbar affect — Overview covers symptoms, treatment of this neurological condition that's characterized by uncontrollable laughing and crying.
treatment: Dextromethorphan hydrobromide and quinidine sulfate Nuedexta

name: Pseudotumor cerebri
description: Headaches and vision loss can result from this increased pressure inside your brain that occurs with no obvious reason.
symptoms: Often severe headaches that might originate behind your eyes
A whooshing sound in your head that pulses with your heartbeat
Brief episodes of blindness, lasting a few seconds and affecting one or both eyes

name: Cutaneous b-cell lymphoma
description: Learn about this type of cancer that starts in the white blood cells and affects the skin. Treatment options include surgery, radiation and chemotherapy.

name: Hay fever
description: Find out more about how to diagnose and get relief from this common condition that can make you feel awful, seasonally and year-round.
symptoms: Itchy nose, roof of mouth or throat
Mucus that runs down the back of your throat (postnasal drip)
Swollen, bruised-appearing skin under the eyes (allergic shiners)
Extreme tiredness (fatigue), often due to poor sleep
risks: Having a condition called atopic dermatitis or eczema, which makes your skin irritated and itchy
Having a blood relative, such as a parent or sibling, with allergies or asthma
Living or working in an environment that constantly exposes you to allergens — such as animal dander or dust mites
Being exposed to smoke and strong odors that irritate the lining of the nose
Having a mother who smoked during your first year of life

name: Plague
description: Learn about the symptoms, risk factors, and treatment of this extremely rare, potentially fatal infectious disease transmitted by fleas and rodents.
preventions: Keep your pets free of fleas

name: Hypothyroidism
description: Understand what happens when your thyroid is underactive and learn about treatment for this condition.
risks: Have a family history of thyroid disease.
Have an autoimmune disease, such as type 1 diabetes or celiac disease.
Received radiation to your neck or upper chest.

name: Cutaneous t-cell lymphoma
description: Learn about this type of non-Hodgkin's lymphoma that attacks the skin. Find out about cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL) symptoms, diagnosis and treatments.
symptoms: Round patches of skin that may be raised or scaly and might be itchy
Patches of skin that appear lighter in color than surrounding skin
Lumps that form on the skin and may break open
Thickening of the skin on the palms of the hands and soles of the feet
A rash-like skin redness over the entire body that is intensely itchy

name: Myelofibrosis
description: Find out more about this bone marrow cancer. Learn about symptoms, diagnosis and treatments for primary myelofibrosis and secondary myelofibrosis.
symptoms: Feeling tired, weak or short of breath, usually because of anemia
Pain or fullness below your ribs on the left side, due to an enlarged spleen
complications: Increased pressure on blood flowing into your liver
Growths in other areas of your body
treatment: Surgical removal of the spleen splenectomy

name: Allergy
description: Allergy symptoms can range from mild to severe, even life-threatening. Most allergies can't be cured, but treatments can help.
symptoms: Itching of the nose, eyes or roof of the mouth
causes: Latex or other substances you touch
risks: Have a family history of asthma or allergies
complications: Sinusitis and infections of the ears or lungs
diagnosis: Ask detailed questions about signs and symptoms
Have you keep a detailed diary of symptoms and possible triggers

name: Plantar fasciitis
description: Learn about this most common cause of stabbing heel pain.
risks: Occupations that keep you on your feet

name: Self injury/cutting
description: Deliberately hurting your own body, such as by cutting or burning, is a harmful way to cope with emotional pain, intense anger and frustration.
symptoms: Fresh cuts, scratches, bruises, bite marks or other wounds.
Excessive rubbing of an area to create a burn.
Keeping sharp objects or other items used for self-injury on hand.
Wearing long sleeves or long pants to hide self-injury, even in hot weather.
Behaviors and emotions that change quickly and are impulsive, intense and unexpected.
Talk of helplessness, hopelessness or worthlessness.
complications: Worsening feelings of shame, guilt and low self-esteem.
Infection, either from wounds or from sharing tools.
Permanent scars or other permanent harm to the body.
Worsening of underlying issues and conditions, if not properly treated.
Severe injury that could possibly lead to death.
preventions: Identify someone at risk and offer help

name: Bags under eyes
description: Learn about causes, treatments and home remedies — including cool compresses and not smoking — for bags under eyes, which become more common as you age.
causes: Fluid retention, especially upon waking or after a salty meal
Genetics — under-eye bags can run in families
Medical conditions, such as dermatitis, dermatomyositis, renal disease and thyroid eye disease

name: Immune thrombocytopenia
description: Caused by low levels of platelets, symptoms may include purple bruises called purpura, as well as tiny reddish-purple dots that look like a rash.

name: Dust mite allergy
description: Dust mite allergy can lead to year-round sniffles and sneezes. Here's how to find relief.
symptoms: Itchy nose, roof of mouth or throat
Swollen, blue-colored skin under your eyes
In a child, frequent upward rubbing of the nose
risks: Having a family history of allergies
Being a child or a young adult

name: Morton's neuroma
description: Learn how this painful foot disorder is diagnosed, as well as its causes and treatment.
symptoms: A feeling as if you're standing on a pebble in your shoe
A burning pain in the ball of your foot that may radiate into your toes
Tingling or numbness in your toes

name: Undescended testicle
description: Learn about causes, complications and treatment of this condition in which one or both testicles aren't in their normal place within the scrotum.
risks: Family history of undescended testicles or other problems of genital development
Conditions of the fetus that can restrict growth, such as Down syndrome or an abdominal wall defect
Alcohol use by the mother during pregnancy
Cigarette smoking by the mother or exposure to secondhand smoke

name: Toe walking
description: Walking on toes or the balls of the feet is fairly common in children who are learning to walk. Most children outgrow it.

name: Stroke
description: Promptly spotting stroke symptoms leads to faster treatment and less damage to the brain.
symptoms: Trouble speaking and understanding what others are saying
Paralysis or numbness of the face arm or leg
Problems seeing in one or both eyes
complications: Paralysis or loss of muscle movement
Changes in behavior and selfcare ability
preventions: Lowering the amount of cholesterol and saturated fat in your diet
Eating a diet rich in fruits and vegetables
Drinking alcohol in moderation if at all

name: Egg allergy
description: Egg allergy can cause a serious reaction in children and adults. Here's how to recognize egg allergy symptoms, and what to do if a severe reaction occurs.
symptoms: Skin inflammation or hives — the most common egg allergy reaction
Nasal congestion, runny nose and sneezing (allergic rhinitis)
Digestive symptoms, such as cramps, nausea and vomiting
Asthma signs and symptoms such as coughing, wheezing, chest tightness or shortness of breath
complications: Allergies to other foods, such as milk, soy or peanuts
Allergies to pet dander, dust mites or grass pollen
Allergic skin reactions such as atopic dermatitis
Asthma, which in turn increases the risk of having a severe allergic reaction to eggs or other foods
preventions: Wear an allergy bracelet or necklace
Let your childs caregivers know about his or her egg allergy

name: Plantar warts
description: Learn about the causes, treatment and prevention of these hard, sometimes painful growths that appear on the heel or ball of the foot.
symptoms: A small, rough growth on the bottom of your foot, usually at the base of the toes or on the ball or heel
On brown and Black skin, the growth may be lighter than unaffected skin
Hard, thickened skin (callus) over a spot on the skin, where a wart has grown inward
Black pinpoints, which are small clotted blood vessels commonly called wart seeds
A cluster of growths on the sole of the foot (mosaic warts)
A growth that interrupts the normal lines and ridges in the skin of your foot
Pain or tenderness when walking or standing
risks: People who have had plantar warts before
People who walk barefoot in areas where a wart-causing virus is common, such as locker rooms and swimming pools
preventions: Avoid direct contact with warts. This includes your own warts. Wash your hands carefully after touching a wart.
Keep your feet clean and dry.
Wear sandals or other foot protection when walking around swimming pools, in locker rooms or in gym showers.
Don't pick at or scratch warts.
When using an emery board, pumice stone or nail clipper on your warts, choose one that you don't use on your healthy skin and nails.

name: IgA nephropathy
description: This disease causes kidney inflammation that, over time, can interfere with your kidneys' ability to filter waste from your blood.
symptoms: Cola- or tea-colored urine (caused by red blood cells in the urine)
Repeated episodes of cola- or tea-colored urine, and sometimes visible blood in your urine, usually during or after an upper respiratory or other infection and sometimes after strenuous exercise
Foamy urine from protein leaking into your urine (proteinuria)
Pain in the one or both sides of your back below your ribs
Swelling (edema) in your hands and feet

name: Undifferentiated pleomorphic sarcoma
description: Learn about this cancer that most often happens in the soft tissues of the arms and legs. Treatments include surgery, radiation therapy and chemotherapy.
symptoms: Growing lump or area of swelling
If it grows very large, there may be pain, tingling and numbness
If it occurs in an arm or leg, there may be swelling in the hand or foot of an affected limb
If it occurs in the abdomen, there may be pain, loss of appetite and constipation
diagnosis: Removing a sample of tissue for testing biopsy

name: Cyclic vomiting syndrome
description: Cyclic vomiting syndrome often starts in childhood and is marked by spells of vomiting several times an hour over a period of hours or days.
symptoms: Three or more recurrent episodes of vomiting that start around the same time and last for a similar length of time
Varying intervals of generally normal health without nausea between episodes
Intense nausea and sweating before an episode starts
causes: Emotional stress or excitement, especially in children
Anxiety or panic attacks, especially in adults
Certain foods and drinks, such as alcohol, caffeine, chocolate or cheese
Overeating, eating right before going to bed or fasting
preventions: For children, downplaying the importance of upcoming events because excitement can be a trigger
Avoiding trigger foods, such as alcohol, caffeine, cheese and chocolate
Eating small meals and low-fat snacks daily at regular times

name: Pleurisy
description: In this condition, the tissues that line the lungs and chest cavity (pleura) become inflamed, causing sharp chest pain that worsens during breathing.
symptoms: Chest pain that worsens when you breathe, cough or sneeze
Shortness of breath — often from trying to limit breathing in and out
causes: Viral infection, such as the flu (influenza)
Autoimmune disorder, such as rheumatoid arthritis or lupus
Lung cancer near the pleural surface
Certain inherited diseases, such as sickle cell disease

name: Food allergy
description: For people with food allergies, symptoms can range from annoying to life-threatening. Learn about diagnosis and treatment of this common immune reaction.
symptoms: Tingling or itching in the mouth
Swelling of the lips, face, tongue and throat or other parts of the body
Wheezing, nasal congestion or trouble breathing
Abdominal pain, diarrhea, nausea or vomiting
causes: Crustacean shellfish, such as shrimp, lobster and crab
Tree nuts, such as walnuts and pecans
treatment: Be sure you know how to use the autoinjector
Carry it with you at all times
Always be sure to replace epinephrine before its expiration date

name: Henoch-Schonlein purpura
description: Learn about the symptoms, causes and treatment of this blood vessel disease, also called IgA vasculitis, that causes a purplish rash on the lower legs.

name: Indigestion
description: Is it indigestion or something else? Find out about causes, symptoms and treatment for this common digestive disorder.
causes: Too much caffeine, alcohol, chocolate or carbonated beverages
Certain antibiotics, pain relievers and iron supplements
diagnosis: Imaging tests Xray or CT scan
treatment: Eating five or six small meals a day instead of three large meals
Reducing or eliminating the use of alcohol and caffeine
Avoiding certain pain relievers, such as aspirin, ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin IB, others) and naproxen sodium (Aleve)
Finding alternatives for medications that trigger indigestion

name: Pleurisy
description: In this condition, the tissues that line the lungs and chest cavity (pleura) become inflamed, causing sharp chest pain that worsens during breathing.
symptoms: Chest pain that worsens when you breathe, cough or sneeze
Shortness of breath — often from trying to limit breathing in and out
causes: Viral infection, such as the flu (influenza)
Autoimmune disorder, such as rheumatoid arthritis or lupus
Lung cancer near the pleural surface
Certain inherited diseases, such as sickle cell disease

name: Cyclothymia
description: Also called cyclothymic disorder, this mood disorder causes emotional ups and downs that are less extreme than bipolar disorder. Learn about treatment.
causes: Differences in the way the brain works
complications: Not treating it can result in significant emotional problems that affect every area of your life
There is a high risk of later developing bipolar I or II disorder
You may also have an anxiety disorder
You may be at increased risk of suicidal thoughts and suicide

name: Latex allergy
description: If rubber gloves, balloons or similar products make you itchy, you could have latex allergy. Know how to spot the symptoms.
risks: People who undergo multiple surgeries or medical procedures
People with a personal or family history of allergies

name: Pseudotumor cerebri
description: Headaches and vision loss can result from this increased pressure inside your brain that occurs with no obvious reason.
symptoms: Often severe headaches that might originate behind your eyes
A whooshing sound in your head that pulses with your heartbeat
Brief episodes of blindness, lasting a few seconds and affecting one or both eyes

name: Primary lateral sclerosis
description: This motor neuron disease causes nerves within the brain to slowly break down, resulting in muscle weakness primarily in the legs, arms and tongue.
symptoms: Stiffness, weakness and muscle spasms (spasticity) in your legs, rarely starting in one leg, and eventually progressing to your arms, hands, tongue and jaw
Tripping, clumsiness and difficulty with balance
Hoarseness, as well as slowed, slurred speech and drooling
Sometimes, frequent, rapid and intense shifts in emotions (mood lability)
Rarely, breathing problems and bladder problems late in the disease

name: Ureteral cancer
description: Find out how doctors use minimally invasive surgery to treat this rare cancer that forms in the tubes that connect your kidneys to your bladder.
diagnosis: Use of a thin lighted tube to view the ureters

name: Cyclothymia
description: Also called cyclothymic disorder, this mood disorder causes emotional ups and downs that are less extreme than bipolar disorder. Learn about treatment.
causes: Differences in the way the brain works
complications: Not treating it can result in significant emotional problems that affect every area of your life
There is a high risk of later developing bipolar I or II disorder
You may also have an anxiety disorder
You may be at increased risk of suicidal thoughts and suicide

name: Milk allergy
description: Find out what happens when the immune system reacts to proteins in milk, causing allergic signs and symptoms such as hives and wheezing.
symptoms: Itching or tingling feeling around the lips or mouth
Swelling of the lips, tongue or throat
diagnosis: Ask detailed questions about signs and symptoms
Have you keep a detailed diary of the foods you or your child eats
Have you eliminate milk from your diet or your child's diet (elimination diet) — and then have you add back the food to see if it causes a reaction

name: Illness anxiety disorder
description: Excessive worry that you're seriously ill based on minor symptoms can result in major emotional distress and disrupt your life. Also called hypochondria.
symptoms: Being preoccupied with having or getting a serious disease or health condition
Worrying that minor symptoms or body sensations mean you have a serious illness
Being easily alarmed about your health status
Finding little or no reassurance from doctor visits or negative test results
Worrying excessively about a specific medical condition or your risk of developing a medical condition because it runs in your family
Having so much distress about possible illnesses that it's hard for you to function
Repeatedly checking your body for signs of illness or disease
Frequently making medical appointments for reassurance — or avoiding medical care for fear of being diagnosed with a serious illness
Avoiding people, places or activities for fear of health risks
Constantly talking about your health and possible illnesses
Frequently searching the internet for causes of symptoms or possible illnesses
risks: A time of major life stress
Threat of a serious illness that turns out not to be serious
History of abuse as a child
A serious childhood illness or a parent with a serious illness
Personality traits, such as having a tendency toward being a worrier
complications: Relationship or family problems because excessive worrying can frustrate others
Work-related performance problems or excessive absences
Problems functioning in daily life, possibly even resulting in disability
Financial problems due to excessive health care visits and medical bills
Having another mental health disorder, such as somatic symptom disorder, other anxiety disorders, depression or a personality disorder
preventions: If you have problems with anxiety seek professional advice
Learn to recognize when youre stressed and how this affects your body
diagnosis: Conduct a psychological evaluation to talk about your symptoms, stressful situations, family history, fears or concerns, and ways that your anxiety is negatively affecting your life
Have you fill out a psychological self-assessment or questionnaire
Ask you about alcohol, drug or other substance use
Determine whether your illness preoccupation is better explained by another mental disorder, such as somatic symptom disorder or generalized anxiety disorder.

name: Pneumonia
description: Pneumonia — Learn about the symptoms, causes and treatment of this serious lung infection.
symptoms: Chest pain when you breathe or cough
Confusion or changes in mental awareness (in adults age 65 and older)
Lower than normal body temperature (in adults older than age 65 and people with weak immune systems)
risks: Children who are 2 years old or younger
People who are age 65 or older
complications: Fluid accumulation around the lungs pleural effusion

name: Bartholin cyst
description: A Bartholin's cyst is a fluid-filled lump near the vaginal opening. It's rarely serious, but when infected, it can be painful.
symptoms: A tender, painful lump near the vaginal opening
diagnosis: Ask questions about your medical history
Take a sample of secretions from your vagina or cervix to test for a sexually transmitted infection
Recommend a test of the mass (biopsy) to check for cancerous cells if you're postmenopausal or over 40

name: Ureteral obstruction
description: Learn about what causes blockage of the tubes that carry urine from the kidneys to the bladder, tests you might need and how the condition can be treated.
symptoms: Changes in how much urine you produce (urine output)

name: Mold allergy
description: Coughing, sneezing and itchy eyes often accompany this common allergy. Find out how to treat this condition and help keep it under control.
risks: Having a family history of allergies
Working in an occupation that exposes you to mold
Living in a house with high humidity
Working or living in a building thats been exposed to excess moisture
Living in a house with poor ventilation
preventions: Eliminate sources of dampness in basements
Be sure all bathrooms are properly ventilated
Keep organic plant containers clean and dry
Toss or recycle old books and newspapers

name: Urethral stricture
description: Narrowing of the tube that carries urine from the body (urethra) can restrict urine flow and cause a variety of problems.
symptoms: Difficulty, straining or pain when urinating
Increased urge to urinate or more-frequent urination
causes: A medical procedure that involves inserting an instrument, such as an endoscope, into the urethra
Intermittent or long-term use of a tube inserted through the urethra to drain the bladder (catheter)
Trauma or injury to the urethra or pelvis
An enlarged prostate or previous surgery to remove or reduce an enlarged prostate gland
Cancer of the urethra or prostate

name: Pneumonitis
description: Pneumonitis is a general term for lung inflammation. It can cause difficulty breathing and is often accompanied by a cough.

name: Immune thrombocytopenia
description: Caused by low levels of platelets, symptoms may include purple bruises called purpura, as well as tiny reddish-purple dots that look like a rash.

name: Ganglion cyst
description: These fluid-filled, noncancerous lumps most often appear on wrists, hands or feet.

name: Nickel allergy
description: Nickel allergy, often caused by nickel in jewelry, is a form of contact dermatitis. Things such as coins and zippers also may provoke nickel allergy.
symptoms: Rash or bumps on the skin
Redness or changes in skin color
Dry patches of skin that may resemble a burn
Blisters and draining fluid in severe cases
risks: Having a family history of nickel allergy

name: Pneumothorax
description: A collapsed lung occurs when air leaks into the space between your lung and chest wall. This air pushes on the outside of your lung and makes it collapse.

name: Immune thrombocytopenia
description: Caused by low levels of platelets, symptoms may include purple bruises called purpura, as well as tiny reddish-purple dots that look like a rash.

name: Urinary incontinence
description: Learn about possible causes of the loss of bladder control and what treatments are available for this problem.
preventions: Avoid bladder irritants, such as caffeine, alcohol and acidic foods
Eat more fiber, which can prevent constipation, a cause of urinary incontinence
Don't smoke, or seek help to quit if you're a smoker

name: Simple kidney cyst
description: These round, fluid-filled pouches on or in the kidneys are sometimes discovered during imaging tests. Find out when treatment may be needed.
symptoms: Dull pain in the back or side
treatment: Piercing and draining the cyst then filling it with a solution

name: POEMS syndrome
description: POEMS syndrome — Learn about diagnosis and treatment options at Mayo Clinic for this rare blood disorder that affects many parts of the body.

name: Peanut allergy
description: Peanut allergy can be serious. Find out what you need to know to prevent a life-threatening reaction, and get the latest on treatment approaches.
symptoms: Skin reactions, such as hives, redness or swelling
Itching or tingling in or around the mouth and throat
Digestive problems, such as diarrhea, stomach cramps, nausea or vomiting

name: Impacted wisdom teeth
description: Impacted wisdom teeth — Learn about symptoms, complications and treatment of impacted wisdom teeth.
symptoms: An unpleasant taste in your mouth
causes: Grow at an angle toward the next tooth (second molar)
Grow at an angle toward the back of the mouth
Grow at a right angle to the other teeth, as if the wisdom tooth is "lying down" within the jawbone
Grow straight up or down like other teeth but stay trapped within the jawbone
diagnosis: Questions about your dental symptoms and general health
An examination of the condition of your teeth and gums
Dental X-rays that can reveal the presence of impacted teeth, as well as signs of damage to teeth or bone

name: UTI
description: Learn the symptoms that may occur if there's an infection in the urinary tract. Also find out what can cause a UTI and how the infection is treated.
symptoms: A strong urge to urinate that doesn't go away
Urinating often, and passing small amounts of urine
Urine that appears red, bright pink or cola-colored — signs of blood in the urine
Pelvic pain, in women — especially in the center of the pelvis and around the area of the pubic bone
complications: Repeated infections, which means you have two or more UTIs within six months or three or more within a year. Women are especially prone to having repeated infections.
Permanent kidney damage from a kidney infection due to an untreated UTI.
Delivering a low birth weight or premature infant when a UTI occurs during pregnancy.
A narrowed urethra in men from having repeated infections of the urethra.
Sepsis, a potentially life-threatening complication of an infection. This is a risk especially if the infection travels up the urinary tract to the kidneys.
preventions: Drink plenty of liquids especially water
Empty your bladder soon after having sex

name: Ovarian cyst
description: Many women have ovarian cysts at some time. Most are harmless, but some can cause serious symptoms. Know what symptoms to watch for.
symptoms: Pelvic pain that may come and go. You may feel a dull ache or a sharp pain in the area below your bellybutton toward one side.
Fullness, pressure or heaviness in your belly (abdomen).

name: Penicillin allergy
description: Understand the importance of an accurate diagnosis for penicillin allergy and the best practices for antibiotic treatment options.
risks: A history of other allergies, such as food allergy or hay fever
A family history of drug allergy
Increased exposure to penicillin, because of high doses, repetitive use or prolonged use
Certain illnesses commonly associated with allergic drug reactions, such as infection with HIV or the Epstein-Barr virus
treatment: Treatment for the current allergy symptoms

name: Poison ivy rash
description: Learn about the symptoms, causes and home remedies for this itchy skin rash and how to prevent it.
symptoms: Difficulty breathing, if you've inhaled the smoke from burning poison ivy
preventions: Wash your skin or your pets fur

name: Prediabetes
description: Blood sugar levels start to rise even before you get type 2 diabetes. Find out what steps you can take to prevent diabetes from developing.
symptoms: Numbness or tingling in the feet or hands
causes: Your pancreas may not make enough insulin
Your cells become resistant to insulin and don't allow as much sugar in
complications: Eye damage, including loss of vision
preventions: Controlling your blood pressure and cholesterol

name: UTI
description: Learn the symptoms that may occur if there's an infection in the urinary tract. Also find out what can cause a UTI and how the infection is treated.
symptoms: A strong urge to urinate that doesn't go away
Urinating often, and passing small amounts of urine
Urine that appears red, bright pink or cola-colored — signs of blood in the urine
Pelvic pain, in women — especially in the center of the pelvis and around the area of the pubic bone
complications: Repeated infections, which means you have two or more UTIs within six months or three or more within a year. Women are especially prone to having repeated infections.
Permanent kidney damage from a kidney infection due to an untreated UTI.
Delivering a low birth weight or premature infant when a UTI occurs during pregnancy.
A narrowed urethra in men from having repeated infections of the urethra.
Sepsis, a potentially life-threatening complication of an infection. This is a risk especially if the infection travels up the urinary tract to the kidneys.
preventions: Drink plenty of liquids especially water
Empty your bladder soon after having sex

name: Pancreatic cyst
description: Most pancreatic cysts are benign, but some types are cancerous. Find out about symptoms, causes and treatment of cysts in the pancreas.
symptoms: Persistent abdominal pain, which may radiate to your back
Feeling full soon after you start eating

name: Polio
description: Learn more about this contagious viral illness that affects the nervous system. Severe disease can lead to paralysis, trouble breathing and sometimes death.
complications: Muscle shortening that causes deformed bones or joints
treatment: Hot moist packs to control muscle pain and spasms
Portable ventilators to help with breathing
Physical therapy exercises to prevent bone deformity and loss of muscle function
Splints or other devices to encourage good position, or alignment, of the spine and limbs

name: Pet allergy
description: Family pet making you sneeze? Find out about diagnosis, treatment and handy household tips for relieving bothersome pet allergy symptoms.
symptoms: Itchy nose, roof of mouth or throat
Swollen, blue-colored skin under your eyes
In a child, frequent upward rubbing of the nose

name: Pilonidal cyst
description: Learn about causes, symptoms and treatments of this painful condition that usually affects the skin above the tailbone in people who sit for long periods.
symptoms: A pit near the top of the buttocks crease.
Pus or blood leaking from an opening in the skin.
risks: Being a young adult white male.
Sitting for long periods at a time.
preventions: Achieve or maintain a healthy weight.

name: Abnormal urine color
description: Foods and medicines can change the color of urine. But a color change also could be a sign of disease.

name: Impetigo
description: Learn about the symptoms, causes and treatment of this highly contagious bacterial skin infection common in infants and young children.
preventions: Gently wash the affected areas with mild soap and running water and then cover lightly with gauze.
Wash an infected person's clothes, linens and towels every day with hot water and don't share them with anyone else in your family.
Wear gloves when applying antibiotic ointment and wash your hands thoroughly afterward.
Cut an infected child's nails short to prevent damage from scratching.
Encourage regular and thorough handwashing and good hygiene in general.
Keep your child with impetigo home until your doctor says they aren't contagious.

name: Polycystic kidney disease
description: Learn how treatments and lifestyle changes might help reduce damage to your kidneys from polycystic kidney disease.
symptoms: A feeling of fullness in your abdomen
Increased size of your abdomen due to enlarged kidneys
