description: Patellofemoral pain syndrome — Comprehensive overview covers symptoms, treatment of this knee condition common among runners.
symptoms: Sit with a bent knee for long periods of time

name: Esophageal spasms
description: This digestive condition is sometimes mistaken for heart pain. Learn about symptoms and treatment for these painful contractions in the esophagus.
treatment: Medicines to relax your swallowing muscles

name: Malignant hyperthermia
description: This rare genetic disorder triggers a severe reaction to certain anesthesia drugs, causing rigid muscles, high fever, fast heart rate and rapid breathing.
symptoms: Rapid, shallow breathing and problems with low oxygen and high carbon dioxide
risks: You only need to inherit one changed gene from a parent to be affected by this disorder (autosomal dominant inheritance pattern). If one of your parents has the gene change that causes MHS, you have a 50% chance of having MHS too.
If you have other relatives with MHS, your chance of having it is also increased.
complications: A rare condition that causes muscle cells to break down (rhabdomyolysis)

name: Bladder stones
description: Minerals in your urine can crystallize if you have trouble emptying your bladder completely, creating this potentially painful condition.
symptoms: Difficulty urinating or interrupted urine flow
preventions: Tell your doctor about unusual urinary symptoms

name: Herniated disk
description: This condition occurs most often in the lower back. In many cases, it causes no symptoms and requires no treatment. Surgery is rarely needed.

name: Esophageal varices
description: Learn how to spot and what to do if you experience signs of this serious complication of liver disease.
symptoms: Loss of consciousness in severe cases
treatment: Using elastic bands to tie off bleeding veins
Medications to slow blood flow into the portal vein
Diverting blood flow away from the portal vein
Placing pressure on varices to stop bleeding
Replacing the diseased liver with a healthy one

name: Mesothelioma
description: Learn about this uncommon cancer that's linked to asbestos exposure. Mesothelioma treatments include surgery, radiation and chemotherapy.
symptoms: Unusual lumps of tissue under the skin on your chest
complications: Pain caused by pressure on the nerves and spinal cord
Accumulation of fluid in the chest (pleural effusion), which can compress the lung nearby and make breathing difficult

name: Bladder cancer
description: Blood in the urine (hematuria) sometimes is a sign of bladder cancer. Learn about other bladder cancer signs and symptoms and explore treatment options.
symptoms: Blood in urine (hematuria), which may cause urine to appear bright red or cola colored, though sometimes the urine appears normal and blood is detected on a lab test
risks: Personal or family history of cancer
preventions: Choose a variety of fruits and vegetables
treatment: Chemotherapy in the bladder intravesical chemotherapy
Chemotherapy for the whole body systemic chemotherapy

name: Ruptured eardrum
description: A ruptured eardrum is a hole or tear in your eardrum, the thin tissue that separates your ear canal from your middle ear.
symptoms: Ear pain that may subside quickly
Mucuslike, pus-filled or bloody drainage from the ear
Nausea or vomiting that can result from vertigo
preventions: Get treatment for middle ear infections
Keep your ears free of foreign objects

name: Esophagitis
description: An inflamed, sore esophagus can make it difficult to swallow and cause chest pain when you eat. Find out what causes this painful condition and your options for treatment.
symptoms: Swallowed food becoming stuck in the esophagus, also known as food impaction.
Chest pain, particularly behind the breastbone, that occurs with eating.
complications: Scarring or narrowing of the esophagus, known as a stricture.
Tearing of the esophageal lining due to retching or passing instruments through an inflamed esophagus during endoscopy.
Barrett's esophagus, a condition in which the cells lining the esophagus are damaged from acid reflux, increasing your risk of esophageal cancer.

name: Malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors
description: MPNSTs are cancers that form in the linings of nerves. Treatment includes surgery, radiation therapy and, sometimes, chemotherapy.
symptoms: Weakness when trying to move the affected body part
A growing lump of tissue under the skin
risks: An inherited condition that increases risk of nerve tumors
diagnosis: Removing a sample of tissue for testing biopsy

name: Urinary incontinence
description: Learn about possible causes of the loss of bladder control and what treatments are available for this problem.
preventions: Avoid bladder irritants, such as caffeine, alcohol and acidic foods
Eat more fiber, which can prevent constipation, a cause of urinary incontinence
Don't smoke, or seek help to quit if you're a smoker

name: Ruptured spleen
description: A break in the surface of your spleen, usually from a forceful blow to your abdomen, can cause life-threatening internal bleeding.
symptoms: Pain in the upper left abdomen
Tenderness when you touch the upper left abdomen
causes: Injury to the left side of the body
diagnosis: Checking for blood in your abdominal cavity

name: Essential tremor
description: Learn about this disorder that causes uncontrollable shaking, and find out how it differs from Parkinson's disease.
symptoms: Begin gradually, usually more prominently on one side of the body
Usually occur in the hands first, affecting one hand or both hands
Can include a "yes-yes" or "no-no" motion of the head
May be aggravated by emotional stress, fatigue, caffeine or temperature extremes
complications: Hold a cup or glass without spilling
Talk, if your voice box or tongue is affected

name: Bladder exstrophy
description: This rare birth defect occurs when the bladder develops outside the fetus during pregnancy. The condition can be repaired with surgery.
diagnosis: Bladder that doesn't fill or empty correctly
Umbilical cord that is placed low on the abdomen
Pubic bones — part of the hipbones that form the pelvis — that are separated
treatment: Provide enough space for urine storage
Create outer sex organs (external genitalia) that look and function acceptably

name: Hammertoe and mallet toe
description: Hammertoe and mallet toe — Comprehensive overview covers causes, symptoms and treatment of these foot deformities.
causes: Abnormal balance of the toe muscles

name: Sacral dimple
description: Learn about the causes, complications and diagnosis of this indentation on the lower back present at birth in some babies.

name: Cystitis
description: Cystitis is a condition that affects the bladder. It happens most often when bacteria cause an infection. But there are other causes, too.
symptoms: A strong, persistent urge to urinate
Pain or a burning feeling when urinating
Passing frequent, small amounts of urine
A feeling of pressure in the area below your belly button (abdomen)
risks: Use certain types of birth control
preventions: Drink plenty of liquids especially water
Wipe from front to back after a bowel movement
Take showers rather than tub baths
Gently wash the skin around the genitals
Empty your bladder as soon as possible after sex
Avoid using deodorant sprays or hygiene products in the genital area

name: Esthesioneuroblastoma
description: Find out about this rare cancer that begins in the upper portion of the nasal cavity. Learn about symptoms and treatments, including minimally invasive surgery.
complications: Cancer that grows to invade nearby structures
Loss of the sense of smell
diagnosis: Using a tiny flexible camera to see in your nose
Removing a sample of tissue for testing
Testing a tissue sample in a lab

name: Median arcuate ligament syndrome
description: Stomach pain after eating isn't always due to indigestion. It could be MALS, also called celiac artery compression.
symptoms: Pain in the upper middle stomach area, which may go away when leaning forward
Stomach pain after eating, exercising or changing body position
Fear of eating food due to pain, leading to significant weight loss — usually greater than 20 pounds (9.1 kilograms)
diagnosis: Computerized tomography CT of the abdomen

name: Sacroiliitis
description: This joint inflammation can cause pain in the buttocks or lower back. The pain can go down one or both legs.
symptoms: Sleeping or sitting for a long time.
Having more weight on one leg than the other.
Taking large steps when moving forward.

name: Interstitial cystitis
description: Bladder pain and urinary frequency flare with certain triggers if you have this condition. Learn about treatments and self-care.
symptoms: Pain in your pelvis or between the vagina and anus in women
Pain between the scrotum and anus (perineum) in men
A persistent, urgent need to urinate
Frequent urination, often of small amounts, throughout the day and night (up to 60 times a day)
Pain or discomfort while the bladder fills and relief after urinating

name: Mammary duct ectasia
description: Mammary duct ectasia is a noncancerous breast condition that affects the milk ducts. Learn the signs and symptoms and when treatment might be needed.
causes: Breast tissue changes due to aging
diagnosis: Diagnostic ultrasound of the nipple and areola

name: Ewing sarcoma
description: Learn about diagnosis and treatment of this bone and soft tissue cancer, including chemotherapy, radiation, proton beam therapy and limb-saving surgery.
symptoms: Pain, swelling or tenderness near the affected area

name: Seasonal affective disorder
description: This type of depression is related to changes in seasons and begins and ends at about the same times every year.
symptoms: Feeling listless, sad or down most of the day, nearly every day
Losing interest in activities you once enjoyed
Having low energy and feeling sluggish
Having problems with sleeping too much
Experiencing carbohydrate cravings, overeating and weight gain
Having thoughts of not wanting to live
risks: Having major depression or bipolar disorder
complications: Other mental health disorders such as anxiety or eating disorders

name: Anterior prolapse
description: Anterior prolapse happens when the pelvic floor muscles weaken and the bladder pushes into the top front part of your vagina. Learn how it's treated.
symptoms: A feeling of fullness or pressure in your pelvis and vagina
In some cases, a bulge of tissue in your vagina that you can see or feel
Increased pelvic pressure when you strain, cough, bear down or lift

Problems urinating, including difficulty starting a urine stream, the feeling that you haven't completely emptied your bladder after urinating, feeling a frequent need to urinate or leaking urine (urinary incontinence)

name: Bipolar disorder
description: Bipolar disorder causes extreme mood swings that include emotional highs (mania or hypomania) and lows (depression).
risks: Having a first-degree relative, such as a parent or sibling, with bipolar disorder
Periods of high stress, such as the death of a loved one or other traumatic event
complications: Problems related to drug and alcohol use
preventions: Take your medications exactly as directed

name: Hirsutism
description: Learn more about causes and complications of unwanted excess hair in women and what self-care methods and medical treatments are effective.

name: Salivary gland tumor
description: Learn about this rare tumor that forms in the salivary glands. Treatments include surgery and radiation therapy.
symptoms: A lump or swelling on or near your jaw or in your neck or mouth
Numbness in part of your face
Muscle weakness on one side of your face
Persistent pain in the area of a salivary gland
diagnosis: Collecting of a sample of tissue for testing biopsy

name: Bladder stones
description: Minerals in your urine can crystallize if you have trouble emptying your bladder completely, creating this potentially painful condition.
symptoms: Difficulty urinating or interrupted urine flow
preventions: Tell your doctor about unusual urinary symptoms

name: Acromegaly
description: An excess of growth hormone causes the bones to keep growing, which can lead to a number of serious complications if left untreated.
symptoms: Enlarged facial features, including the facial bones, lips, nose and tongue
Small outgrowths of skin tissue (skin tags)
Fatigue and joint or muscle weakness
A deepened, husky voice due to enlarged vocal cords and sinuses
Severe snoring due to obstruction of the upper airway
Headaches, which may be persistent or severe
complications: Heart problems, particularly enlargement of the heart (cardiomyopathy)
Precancerous growths (polyps) on the lining of your colon
Sleep apnea, a condition in which breathing repeatedly stops and starts during sleep
treatment: Drugs that reduce growth hormone production somatostatin analogues
Drugs to lower hormone levels dopamine agonists
Drug to block the action of GH growth hormone antagonist

name: Marfan syndrome
description: This inherited disorder affects the skeleton and the eyes. It can also harm the large blood vessel that carries blood from the heart to the rest of the body.

name: Salmonella infection
description: This common bacterial infection is spread through contaminated food or water and affects the intestinal tract. Learn more about prevention and treatment.
risks: Activities that may bring you into closer contact with salmonella bacteria
Health problems that may weaken your resistance to infection in general

name: Narcolepsy
description: Learn more about this sleep disorder that causes periods of involuntary sleep, sleep paralysis and early rapid eye movement (REM) sleep.
symptoms: Changes in rapid eye movement REM sleep
diagnosis: A sleep study known as polysomnography
Genetic tests and a lumbar puncture known as a spinal tap
treatment: Serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors SNRIs or selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors SSRIs
Sodium oxybate Xyrem and oxybate salts Xywav

name: Blastocystis hominis infection
description: This microscopic organism is a parasite that can live in your digestive system. Whether it causes digestive problems isn't clear.
risks: Are exposed to human feces at work, such as a children's day care
Travel to a country with poor water sanitation
preventions: Wash fruits and vegetables before eating
treatment: Antibiotics, such as metronidazole (Flagyl) or tinidazole (Tindamax)
Combination medications, such as sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim (Bactrim, Septra, others)
Anti-protozoal medications, such as paromomycin or nitazoxanide (Alinia)

name: Breast pain
description: Learn about possible causes and treatments for breast pain, along with self-care remedies that may help keep you comfortable when breast pain flares.
preventions: Avoid excessive or prolonged lifting activities
Consider using an overthecounter pain reliever
treatment: Eliminate an underlying cause or aggravating factor
Use a topical nonsteroidal antiinflammatory NSAID medication
Reduce the dose of menopausal hormone therapy

name: Salmonella infection
description: This common bacterial infection is spread through contaminated food or water and affects the intestinal tract. Learn more about prevention and treatment.
risks: Activities that may bring you into closer contact with salmonella bacteria
Health problems that may weaken your resistance to infection in general

name: Blastocystis hominis infection
description: This microscopic organism is a parasite that can live in your digestive system. Whether it causes digestive problems isn't clear.
risks: Are exposed to human feces at work, such as a children's day care
Travel to a country with poor water sanitation
preventions: Wash fruits and vegetables before eating
treatment: Antibiotics, such as metronidazole (Flagyl) or tinidazole (Tindamax)
Combination medications, such as sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim (Bactrim, Septra, others)
Anti-protozoal medications, such as paromomycin or nitazoxanide (Alinia)

name: Menorrhagia
description: Learn about the causes and treatment of heavy menstrual periods.
symptoms: Soaking through one or more sanitary pads or tampons every hour for several consecutive hours
Needing to use double sanitary protection to control your menstrual flow
Needing to wake up to change sanitary protection during the night
Bleeding for longer than a week
Passing blood clots larger than a quarter
Restricting daily activities due to heavy menstrual flow
Symptoms of anemia, such as tiredness, fatigue or shortness of breath

name: Mastitis
description: Redness, pain and swelling in your breast could be mastitis — inflammation of breast tissue. Find out about mastitis symptoms, treatment and self-care.
symptoms: Breast tenderness or warmth to the touch
Thickening of breast tissue, or a breast lump
Pain or a burning sensation continuously or while breast-feeding
Skin redness, often in a wedge-shaped pattern
Fever of 101 F (38.3 C) or greater
risks: Previous bout of mastitis while breast-feeding
Sore or cracked nipples — although mastitis can develop without broken skin
Wearing a tightfitting bra or putting pressure on your breast when using a seat belt or carrying a heavy bag, which may restrict milk flow
preventions: Fully drain the milk from your breasts while breast-feeding.
Allow your baby to completely empty one breast before switching to the other breast during feeding.
Change the position you use to breast-feed from one feeding to the next.
Make sure your baby latches on properly during feedings.
If you smoke, ask your doctor about smoking cessation.

name: Sarcoidosis
description: This inflammatory disease results in growth of tiny granulomas in different parts of the body, including the lungs, eyes, skin and heart.
diagnosis: Blood and urine tests to assess your overall health and how well your kidneys and liver are functioning
Chest X-ray to check your lungs and heart
Computerized tomography (CT) scan of the chest to check your lungs
Lung (pulmonary) function tests to measure lung volume and how much oxygen your lungs deliver to your blood
Electrocardiogram (ECG or EKG) to detect heart problems and monitor the heart's status
Eye exam to check for vision problems that may be caused by sarcoidosis
Positron emission tomography (PET) scan or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) if sarcoidosis seems to be affecting your heart or central nervous system
treatment: Medications that suppress the immune system

name: Exercise headache
description: Learn about the causes and treatments of this puzzling disorder.
risks: Have a personal or family history of migraine
diagnosis: Your headaches last more than a few hours
Your headaches strike suddenly, like a thunderclap
You have other signs and symptoms, such as nausea, vomiting or vision disturbances

name: Blepharitis
description: This often chronic eyelid condition can be difficult to treat. It might be uncomfortable, but it doesn't usually damage eyesight and isn't contagious.
symptoms: A gritty, burning or stinging sensation in the eyes
Flaking of the skin around the eyes
Blurred vision that usually improves with blinking
causes: Seborrheic dermatitis — dandruff of the scalp and eyebrows
Clogged or malfunctioning oil glands in your eyelids
Rosacea — a skin condition characterized by facial redness
Allergies, including allergic reactions to eye medications, contact lens solutions or eye makeup
treatment: Medications that affect the immune system

name: MCAD deficiency
description: This inherited genetic disorder prevents the breakdown of certain fats needed for energy, causing dangerously low blood sugar (hypoglycemia) if not treated.
treatment: Avoid fasting longer than recommended by your health care team
Eat regular meals and snacks with adequate calories from complex carbohydrates, such as brown bread, rice, pasta and cereal, for energy needs
Choose foods that are high in complex carbohydrates and lower in fat
Increase calories by eating extra complex carbohydrates during illness, stress or increased activity

name: Exercise-induced asthma
description: Regular exercise is beneficial in many ways, but for some people, exercise can trigger breathing problems. Medicine can help.
symptoms: Avoiding activity, which happens mostly in young children.
complications: Serious or life-threatening breathing difficulties, particularly among people with poorly managed asthma.
Lower quality of life because of inability to exercise.

name: Sarcoma
description: Learn about this cancer that forms in the bones and the connective tissue. Find out about symptoms, diagnosis, treatment and the many types of sarcoma.
symptoms: A lump that can be felt through the skin that may or may not be painful
A broken bone that happens unexpectedly, such as with a minor injury or no injury at all
diagnosis: Removing a sample of tissue for testing biopsy

name: Muscular dystrophy
description: Read about different types of this progressive disease that interferes with the creation of new muscle, as well as treatments to help with symptoms.
complications: Shortening of muscles or tendons around joints contractures
treatment: Corticosteroids, such as prednisone and deflazacort (Emflaza), which can help muscle strength and delay the progression of certain types of muscular dystrophy. But prolonged use of these types of drugs can cause weight gain and weakened bones, increasing fracture risk.
Heart medications, such as angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitors or beta blockers, if muscular dystrophy damages the heart.

name: Blocked tear duct
description: Watery, irritated eyes may occur when your tears can't drain normally. Learn about this common eye condition that affects newborns and sometimes, adults.
symptoms: Redness of the white part of the eye
Recurrent eye infection or inflammation (pink eye)
Painful swelling near the inside corner of the eye
Mucus or pus discharge from the lids and surface of the eye
preventions: Wash your hands thoroughly and often.
Try not to rub your eyes.
Replace your eyeliner and mascara regularly. Never share these cosmetics with others.
If you wear contact lenses, keep them clean according to recommendations provided by the manufacturer and your eye care specialist.

name: Swimmer's ear
description: The moist environment from water remaining in your ear after swimming or bathing can lead to this infection in the outer ear canal.
risks: Excess moisture in your ear canal
complications: Bone and cartilage damage early skull base osteomyelitis
preventions: Use caution after an ear infection or surgery
Avoid putting foreign objects in your ear

name: Bone cancer
description: Bone cancer most commonly affects the long bones in the arms and legs. Some varieties occur primarily in children, while others affect mostly adults.
symptoms: Swelling and tenderness near the affected area

name: Ureteral obstruction
description: Learn about what causes blockage of the tubes that carry urine from the kidneys to the bladder, tests you might need and how the condition can be treated.
symptoms: Changes in how much urine you produce (urine output)

name: Chronic fatigue syndrome
description: This complicated disorder may be triggered by an infection. While there's no cure for chronic fatigue syndrome, treatment focuses on easing symptoms.
symptoms: Extreme exhaustion after physical or mental exercise.
Problems with memory or thinking skills.
Dizziness that worsens with moving from lying down or sitting to standing.

name: Premature ventricular contractions
description: Premature ventricular contractions (PVCs) are extra heartbeats that disrupt the heart rhythm. PVCs are common.
risks: Stimulants such as cocaine or methamphetamines
Exercise — if you have certain types of PVCs
Heart disease, including congenital heart disease, coronary artery disease, heart failure and a weakened heart muscle (cardiomyopathy)

name: Soft tissue sarcoma
description: This rare type of cancer can begin in the muscles, fat, blood vessels, nerves, tendons and the lining of joints. Treatment usually includes surgery.
symptoms: Pain, if a tumor presses on nerves or muscles

name: Measles
description: Learn about this vaccine-preventable disease that used to be common in childhood and is well known for a characteristic red, splotchy rash and high fever.
symptoms: Tiny white spots with bluish-white centers on a red background found inside the mouth on the inner lining of the cheek — also called Koplik's spots
A skin rash made up of large, flat blotches that often flow into one another

name: Blood in urine
description: Lots of things can cause bloody urine. Some are serious problems, and others are harmless. Find out why it's always important to get a checkup.
treatment: Taking antibiotic medicines to clear a urinary tract infection.
Trying a prescription medicine to shrink an enlarged prostate.
Having a treatment that uses sound waves to break up bladder or kidney stones.

name: Eye floaters
description: Many people over age 50 experience eye floaters. Learn more about this common problem, including causes, other risk factors and treatment options.
symptoms: Small shapes in your vision that appear as dark specks or knobby, transparent strings of floating material
Spots that move when you move your eyes, so when you try to look at them, they move quickly out of your line of vision
Spots that are most noticeable when you look at a plain bright background, such as a blue sky or a white wall
Small shapes or strings that eventually settle down and drift out of the line of vision
risks: Diabetes complication that causes damage to the blood vessels of the retina (diabetic retinopathy)
treatment: Using a laser to disrupt the floaters

name: Rubella
description: Learn more about the symptoms and prevention of this contagious viral infection best known for its distinctive red rash.
symptoms: Mild fever of 102 F (38.9 C) or lower
Enlarged, tender lymph nodes at the base of the skull, the back of the neck and behind the ears
A fine, pink rash that begins on the face and quickly spreads to the trunk and then the arms and legs, before disappearing in the same order
Aching joints, especially in young women
complications: Problems with the development of the heart (congenital heart defects)
Problems with the development of other organs
Problems with mental development and learning

name: Burning mouth syndrome
description: This chronic burning, without an obvious cause, may affect the tongue, gums, lips, cheeks, roof of your mouth or widespread areas of your mouth.
symptoms: A burning or scalding sensation that most commonly affects your tongue, but may also affect your lips, gums, palate, throat or whole mouth
A sensation of dry mouth with increased thirst
Taste changes in your mouth, such as a bitter or metallic taste
Tingling, stinging or numbness in your mouth
diagnosis: Review your medical history and medications
Ask you to describe your symptoms, oral habits and oral care routine

name: Small intestinal bacterial overgrowth
description: Small intestinal bacterial overgrowth (SIBO) can occur when excess bacteria builds up in the small intestine. Learn more about this bowel disorder.
symptoms: An uncomfortable feeling of fullness after eating
risks: Gastric surgery for obesity or ulcers
A structural defect in the small intestine
An injury to the small intestine
An abnormal passageway (fistula) between two segments of bowel
Crohn's disease, intestinal lymphoma or scleroderma involving the small intestine
History of radiation therapy to the abdomen
Adhesions caused by previous abdominal surgery
complications: Poor absorption of fats carbohydrates and proteins
diagnosis: Small intestine aspirate and fluid culture

name: Eye melanoma
description: Eye melanoma is a type of eye cancer. Learn about symptoms and treatments for this rare cancer. It's also called ocular melanoma or uveal melanoma.
symptoms: A sensation of flashes or specks of dust in your vision (floaters)
A growing dark spot on the iris
A change in the shape of the dark circle (pupil) at the center of your eye
Poor or blurry vision in one eye
complications: Increasing pressure within the eye glaucoma
Eye melanoma that spreads beyond the eye
diagnosis: Imaging of the blood vessels in and around the tumor angiogram
Removing a sample of suspicious tissue for testing

name: Body dysmorphic disorder
description: This mental disorder causes persistent, intense focus, shame and anxiety over perceived body defects, often resulting in many cosmetic procedures as a fix.
symptoms: Being extremely preoccupied with a perceived flaw in appearance that to others can't be seen or appears minor
Strong belief that you have a defect in your appearance that makes you ugly or deformed
Belief that others take special notice of your appearance in a negative way or mock you
Engaging in behaviors aimed at fixing or hiding the perceived flaw that are difficult to resist or control, such as frequently checking the mirror, grooming or skin picking
Attempting to hide perceived flaws with styling, makeup or clothes
Constantly comparing your appearance with others
Frequently seeking reassurance about your appearance from others
Seeking cosmetic procedures with little satisfaction
risks: Having blood relatives with body dysmorphic disorder or obsessive-compulsive disorder
Negative life experiences, such as childhood teasing, neglect or abuse
Certain personality traits, such as perfectionism
Societal pressure or expectations of beauty
Having another mental health condition, such as anxiety or depression
complications: Major depression or other mood disorders
Anxiety disorders, including social anxiety disorder (social phobia)
Health problems from behaviors such as skin picking
Physical pain or risk of disfigurement due to repeated surgical interventions
diagnosis: A psychological evaluation that assesses risk factors and thoughts, feelings, and behaviors related to negative self-image
Personal, social, family and medical history

name: Golfer's elbow
description: Golfers, tennis players and others who repeatedly use their wrists or clench their fingers can develop this painful condition.
risks: Performing repetitive activity at least two hours a day

name: Scabies
description: Learn more about this contagious condition that causes intense itching, usually in areas where the skin folds, such as around joints.
symptoms: Itching, often severe and usually worse at night
Thin, wavy tunnels made up of tiny blisters or bumps on the skin
complications: People with weakened immune systems, such as those with HIV or lymphoma, or people who have had organ transplants
People who are very sick, such as people in hospitals or nursing facilities

name: Blepharitis
description: This often chronic eyelid condition can be difficult to treat. It might be uncomfortable, but it doesn't usually damage eyesight and isn't contagious.
symptoms: A gritty, burning or stinging sensation in the eyes
Flaking of the skin around the eyes
Blurred vision that usually improves with blinking
causes: Seborrheic dermatitis — dandruff of the scalp and eyebrows
Clogged or malfunctioning oil glands in your eyelids
Rosacea — a skin condition characterized by facial redness
Allergies, including allergic reactions to eye medications, contact lens solutions or eye makeup
treatment: Medications that affect the immune system

name: Body lice infestation
description: Body lice are tiny insects that live in your clothing and feed on your blood. Find out how to treat and prevent this itchy nuisance of a bug.

name: Shin splints
description: Shin splints are common in runners, dancers and military recruits. Learn how modifying your exercise routine can help prevent shin splints from recurring.
risks: You're a runner, especially one beginning a running program
You suddenly increase the duration, frequency or intensity of exercise
You run on uneven terrain, such as hills, or hard surfaces, such as concrete
You have flat feet or high arches
preventions: Add strength training to your workout

name: Spontaneous coronary artery dissection
description: A torn blood vessel in the heart can cause a heart attack. Learn about the diagnosis and treatment of this medical emergency.
symptoms: A rapid heartbeat or fluttery feeling in the chest
Pain in the arms, shoulders, back or jaw

name: Eyestrain
description: Gazing for long stretches at computer or digital screens is a frequent eyestrain culprit. Find out how to relieve — and prevent — this common problem.
symptoms: Sore, tired, burning or itching eyes
Increased sensitivity to light, called photophobia
Feeling that you cannot keep your eyes open
causes: Reading without pausing to rest your eyes
Driving long distances and doing other activities involving focusing for a long time
Being exposed to bright light or glare
Straining to see in very dim light
Having an underlying eye problem, such as dry eyes or uncorrected vision, called refractive error
Being exposed to dry moving air from a fan, a heating system or an air-conditioning system

name: Sweating and body odor
description: Learn more about the causes, treatment and self-care of this skin condition. Unusual changes may mean a medical problem.
symptoms: You suddenly begin to sweat much more or less than usual
You experience night sweats for no apparent reason
You notice a change in your body odor

name: Median arcuate ligament syndrome
description: Stomach pain after eating isn't always due to indigestion. It could be MALS, also called celiac artery compression.
symptoms: Pain in the upper middle stomach area, which may go away when leaning forward
Stomach pain after eating, exercising or changing body position
Fear of eating food due to pain, leading to significant weight loss — usually greater than 20 pounds (9.1 kilograms)
diagnosis: Computerized tomography CT of the abdomen

name: Burning mouth syndrome
description: This chronic burning, without an obvious cause, may affect the tongue, gums, lips, cheeks, roof of your mouth or widespread areas of your mouth.
symptoms: A burning or scalding sensation that most commonly affects your tongue, but may also affect your lips, gums, palate, throat or whole mouth
A sensation of dry mouth with increased thirst
Taste changes in your mouth, such as a bitter or metallic taste
Tingling, stinging or numbness in your mouth
diagnosis: Review your medical history and medications
Ask you to describe your symptoms, oral habits and oral care routine

name: Hirsutism
description: Learn more about causes and complications of unwanted excess hair in women and what self-care methods and medical treatments are effective.

name: Boils and carbuncles
description: Learn about symptoms, causes, treatment and prevention of these painful pus-filled infections that cause bumps under your skin or leaking sores.
risks: Close contact with a person who has a staph infection
preventions: Wash your hands regularly with mild soap

name: Medication overuse headache
description: When medications that ease headache pain are used too often, these drugs can actually start causing headaches. Learn about prevention and treatment.
symptoms: Occur every day or nearly every day, often waking you in the early morning
Improve with pain relief medication but then return as your medication wears off
preventions: Take your headache medication as prescribed.
If you need headache medication more than twice a week, contact your doctor.
Avoid medications that contain butalbital or opioids.
Use OTC painkillers less than 15 days a month.
Limit use of triptans or combination analgesics to no more than nine days a month.

name: Scarlet fever
description: Learn more about the symptoms, causes, complications and treatment of this strep bacterial infection that causes a red rash, sore throat and high fever.
preventions: Dont share dining utensils or food
diagnosis: Look at the condition of your child's throat, tonsils and tongue
Feel your child's neck to determine if lymph nodes are enlarged
Assess the appearance and texture of the rash

name: Bell's palsy
description: Learn more about Bell's palsy, which causes temporary facial paralysis. Find out why Bell's palsy happens and what to do about it.
causes: Cold sores and genital herpes (herpes simplex)
risks: Are pregnant, especially during the third trimester, or who are in the first week after giving birth
Have an upper respiratory infection, such as the flu or a cold
complications: Irreversible damage to your facial nerve.

Irregular regrowth of nerve fibers. This may result in involuntary contraction of certain muscles when you're trying to move other muscles (synkinesis). For example, when you smile, the eye on the affected side may close.
Partial or complete blindness of the eye that won't close. This is caused by excessive dryness and scratching of the clear protective covering of the eye (cornea).

name: Thalassemia
description: Some forms of this inherited blood disorder usually show up before the age of 2, often causing anemia. More severe forms of the disease require regular blood transfusions.

name: Bone cancer
description: Bone cancer most commonly affects the long bones in the arms and legs. Some varieties occur primarily in children, while others affect mostly adults.
symptoms: Swelling and tenderness near the affected area

name: Scarlet fever
description: Learn more about the symptoms, causes, complications and treatment of this strep bacterial infection that causes a red rash, sore throat and high fever.
preventions: Dont share dining utensils or food
diagnosis: Look at the condition of your child's throat, tonsils and tongue
Feel your child's neck to determine if lymph nodes are enlarged
Assess the appearance and texture of the rash

name: Factitious disorder
description: Factitious disorder ― a serious mental disorder in which someone deceives others by appearing sick, by purposely getting sick or by self-injury.
symptoms: Extensive knowledge of medical terms and diseases
Conditions that get worse for no apparent reason
Conditions that don't respond as expected to standard therapies
Seeking treatment from many different doctors or hospitals, which may include using a fake name
Reluctance to allow doctors to talk to family or friends or to other health care professionals
Eagerness to have frequent testing or risky operations
Many surgical scars or evidence of numerous procedures
risks: Childhood trauma, such as emotional, physical or sexual abuse
Loss of a loved one through death, illness or abandonment
Past experiences during a time of sickness and the attention it brought
A poor sense of identity or self-esteem
Desire to be associated with doctors or medical centers
Work in the health care field
complications: Injury or death from self-inflicted medical conditions
Severe health problems from infections or unnecessary surgery or other procedures
Loss of organs or limbs from unnecessary surgery
Significant problems in daily life, relationships and work
Abuse when the behavior is inflicted on another
diagnosis: The person's medical history doesn't make sense
No believable reason exists for an illness or injury
The illness does not follow the usual course
There is a lack of healing for no apparent reason, despite appropriate treatment
There are contradictory or inconsistent symptoms or lab test results
The person resists getting information from previous medical records, other health care professionals or family members
The person is caught in the act of lying or causing an injury

name: Medulloblastoma
description: Medulloblastoma is the most common cancerous brain tumor in children. Treatment usually includes a combination of surgery, radiation and chemotherapy.
diagnosis: Collecting and testing a sample of abnormal tissue biopsy

name: Osteomyelitis
description: Bones don't easily get infected, but certain situations, such as a serious injury, bloodstream infection or surgery, may lead to a bone infection.
symptoms: Swelling, warmth and redness over the area of the infection
Pain in the area of the infection

name: Schizoaffective disorder
description: This mental health disorder includes schizophrenia symptoms, such as delusions or hallucinations, and mood disorder symptoms, such as depression or mania.
symptoms: Delusions — having false, fixed beliefs, despite evidence to the contrary
Hallucinations, such as hearing voices or seeing things that aren't there
Impaired communication and speech, such as being incoherent
Symptoms of depression, such as feeling empty, sad or worthless
Periods of manic mood, with an increase in energy and a decreased need for sleep over several days, and behaviors that are out of character
Impaired occupational, academic and social functioning
Problems with managing personal care, including cleanliness and physical appearance
risks: Having a close blood relative — such as a parent or sibling — who has schizoaffective disorder, schizophrenia or bipolar disorder
Stressful events that may trigger symptoms
Taking mind-altering drugs, which may worsen symptoms when an underlying disorder is present
complications: Suicide, suicide attempts or suicidal thoughts
Alcohol or other substance use problems

name: Factor V Leiden
description: This inherited clotting disorder can increase your chance of developing abnormal blood clots, most commonly in your legs or lungs.
treatment: A short course of blood thinners
Leg wraps that inflate and deflate to keep blood moving in your legs
Going for walks soon after surgery

name: Hirschsprung's disease
description: This digestive disorder that's present at birth affects the nerves in the colon. It causes severe constipation but can be treated.
symptoms: Vomiting, including vomiting a green or brown substance
Constipation or gas, which might make a newborn fussy
Delayed passage of meconium — a newborn's first bowel movement
risks: Having a sibling who has Hirschsprungs disease
diagnosis: Removing a sample of colon tissue for testing biopsy
Abdominal Xray using a contrast dye
Measuring control of the muscles around the rectum anal manometry

name: Schizoid personality disorder
description: Schizoid personality disorder is an uncommon condition in which people consistently shy away from interaction with others and have a limited range of emotional expression.
symptoms: Prefer being alone and choose to do activities alone
Don't want or enjoy close relationships
Feel little if any desire for sexual relationships
Feel like you can't experience pleasure
Have difficulty expressing emotions and reacting appropriately to situations
May seem humorless, indifferent or emotionally cold to others
May appear to lack motivation and goals
Don't react to praise or critical remarks from others
risks: Having a parent or other relative who has schizoid personality disorder, schizotypal personality disorder or schizophrenia
Having a parent who was cold, neglectful or unresponsive to emotional needs
complications: Developing schizotypal personality disorder, schizophrenia or another delusional disorder
diagnosis: Symptoms listed in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-5), published by the American Psychiatric Association

name: Bone metastasis
description: Learn about the symptoms and causes of cancer that spreads to the bones. Find out about treatments, including medications, radiation and surgery.
symptoms: Weakness in the legs or arms
High levels of calcium in the blood (hypercalcemia), which can cause nausea, vomiting, constipation and confusion

name: Flatfeet
description: A common and usually painless condition, flatfeet occurs when the arches of the feet flatten upon standing, allowing the entire soles to touch the floor.
risks: Injury to the foot or ankle

name: Vitamin deficiency anemia
description: A lack of folate and vitamin B-12 can cause a type of anemia in which red blood cells become too large and can't carry oxygen properly.
symptoms: Numbness or tingling in the hands and feet
preventions: Fortified foods, such as breakfast cereals
diagnosis: The number and appearance of red blood cells
The amount of vitamin B-12 and folate in the blood
The presence of antibodies to intrinsic factor, which indicates pernicious anemia
treatment: Injections into a muscle or under the skin
A liquid or tablet that dissolves under the tongue

name: Schizophrenia
description: This severe mental disorder can result in hallucinations, delusions, and extremely disordered thinking and behavior that interfere with daily living.
symptoms: A drop in performance at school
risks: Having a family history of schizophrenia
Some pregnancy and birth complications, such as malnutrition or exposure to toxins or viruses that may impact brain development
Taking mind-altering (psychoactive or psychotropic) drugs during teen years and young adulthood
complications: Suicide, suicide attempts and thoughts of suicide
Abuse of alcohol or other drugs, including nicotine
Inability to work or attend school

name: Bone spurs
description: Joint damage due to osteoarthritis is the most common cause of bone spurs. Most bone spurs create no problems and don't need treatment.

name: Tetralogy of Fallot
description: Learn more about a rare condition caused by a combination of four heart defects that are present at birth (congenital).
symptoms: A bluish coloration of the skin caused by low blood oxygen levels (cyanosis)
Shortness of breath and rapid breathing, especially during feeding or exercise
Tiring easily during play or exercise
An abnormal, rounded shape of the nail bed in the fingers and toes (clubbing)
causes: Narrowing of the lung valve pulmonary valve stenosis
A hole between the bottom heart chambers ventricular septal defect
Shifting of the bodys main artery aorta
Thickening of the right lower heart chamber right ventricular hypertrophy
risks: A viral illness during pregnancy, such as rubella (German measles)
A parent who has tetralogy of Fallot
The presence of Down syndrome or DiGeorge syndrome in the baby
complications: Leaking pulmonary valve (chronic pulmonary regurgitation), in which blood leaks through the valve back into the pumping chamber (right ventricle)
Holes in the wall between the ventricles (ventricular septal defects) that may continue to leak after repair or may need re-repair
Enlarged right ventricle or left ventricle that isn't working properly
Enlargement of the ascending aorta (aortic root dilation)

name: Childhood schizophrenia
description: This severe mental disorder in children involves hallucinations, delusions, and disordered thinking and behavior that can impair the ability to function.
risks: Having a family history of schizophrenia
Increased immune system activation, such as from inflammation
Some pregnancy and birth complications, such as malnutrition or exposure to toxins or viruses that may impact brain development
Taking mind-altering (psychoactive) drugs during teen years
complications: Suicide, suicide attempts and thoughts of suicide
Anxiety disorders, panic disorders and obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD)
Abuse of alcohol or other drugs, including nicotine
Inability to live independently, attend school or work
Legal and financial problems, and homelessness

name: Melanoma
description: Learn about melanoma symptoms, such as suspicious moles, and find out about melanoma treatments, including surgery, radiation therapy and immunotherapy.
risks: Living closer to the equator or at a higher elevation
Having many moles or unusual moles
preventions: Avoid the sun during the middle of the day
Become familiar with your skin so that youll notice changes

name: Borderline personality disorder
description: This mental health disorder includes a pattern of unstable intense relationships, distorted self-image, extreme emotions and impulsiveness.
symptoms: An intense fear of abandonment, even going to extreme measures to avoid real or imagined separation or rejection
A pattern of unstable intense relationships, such as idealizing someone one moment and then suddenly believing the person doesn't care enough or is cruel
Rapid changes in self-identity and self-image that include shifting goals and values, and seeing yourself as bad or as if you don't exist at all
Periods of stress-related paranoia and loss of contact with reality, lasting from a few minutes to a few hours

Impulsive and risky behavior, such as gambling, reckless driving, unsafe sex, spending sprees, binge eating or drug abuse, or sabotaging success by suddenly quitting a good job or ending a positive relationship
Suicidal threats or behavior or self-injury, often in response to fear of separation or rejection
Wide mood swings lasting from a few hours to a few days, which can include intense happiness, irritability, shame or anxiety
Inappropriate, intense anger, such as frequently losing your temper, being sarcastic or bitter, or having physical fights
complications: Multiple legal issues, such as jail time
Conflict-filled relationships, marital stress or divorce
Self-injury, such as cutting or burning, and frequent hospitalizations
Unplanned pregnancies, sexually transmitted infections, motor vehicle accidents and physical fights due to impulsive and risky behavior
diagnosis: Detailed interview with your doctor or mental health provider
Psychological evaluation that may include completing questionnaires
Discussion of your signs and symptoms

name: Familial adenomatous polyposis
description: This inherited condition leads to colon cancer. Treatment consists of having frequent screenings and having surgery to remove all or part of the colon.
complications: Congenital hypertrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium CHRPE
Low numbers of red blood cells anemia

name: Childhood schizophrenia
description: This severe mental disorder in children involves hallucinations, delusions, and disordered thinking and behavior that can impair the ability to function.
risks: Having a family history of schizophrenia
Increased immune system activation, such as from inflammation
Some pregnancy and birth complications, such as malnutrition or exposure to toxins or viruses that may impact brain development
Taking mind-altering (psychoactive) drugs during teen years
complications: Suicide, suicide attempts and thoughts of suicide
Anxiety disorders, panic disorders and obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD)
Abuse of alcohol or other drugs, including nicotine
Inability to live independently, attend school or work
Legal and financial problems, and homelessness

name: Eye melanoma
description: Eye melanoma is a type of eye cancer. Learn about symptoms and treatments for this rare cancer. It's also called ocular melanoma or uveal melanoma.
symptoms: A sensation of flashes or specks of dust in your vision (floaters)
A growing dark spot on the iris
A change in the shape of the dark circle (pupil) at the center of your eye
Poor or blurry vision in one eye
complications: Increasing pressure within the eye glaucoma
Eye melanoma that spreads beyond the eye
diagnosis: Imaging of the blood vessels in and around the tumor angiogram
Removing a sample of suspicious tissue for testing

name: Botulism
description: This rare but serious condition can be caused by bacteria that have contaminated food or a wound. Learn more about how to prevent botulism.

name: Familial hypercholesterolemia
description: This inherited condition can cause extremely high levels of

name: Childhood schizophrenia
description: This severe mental disorder in children involves hallucinations, delusions, and disordered thinking and behavior that can impair the ability to function.
risks: Having a family history of schizophrenia
Increased immune system activation, such as from inflammation
Some pregnancy and birth complications, such as malnutrition or exposure to toxins or viruses that may impact brain development
Taking mind-altering (psychoactive) drugs during teen years
complications: Suicide, suicide attempts and thoughts of suicide
Anxiety disorders, panic disorders and obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD)
Abuse of alcohol or other drugs, including nicotine
Inability to live independently, attend school or work
Legal and financial problems, and homelessness

name: Multiple endocrine neoplasia type 2
description: Learn about this rare disorder that causes tumors and overproduction of hormones.
diagnosis: Urine or plasma testing for catecholamines and metanephrines

name: Fecal incontinence
description: Learn about this common issue that causes some people to avoid social situations. Treatments are available.
causes: Loss of storage capacity in the rectum

name: Familial Mediterranean fever
description: This genetic autoinflammatory disorder causes recurrent fevers and painful inflammation. Treatment can prevent attacks and complications.
symptoms: Chest pain, which can make it hard to breathe deeply
Painful, swollen joints, usually in the knees, ankles and hips
A red rash on your legs, especially below your knees
diagnosis: Review of your family medical history

name: Schizotypal personality disorder
description: This personality disorder may include odd or eccentric thinking and behavior, few ― if any ― close relationships, and a significant distrust of others.
symptoms: Being a loner and lacking close friends outside of the immediate family
Flat emotions or limited or inappropriate emotional responses
Incorrect interpretation of events, such as a feeling that something that is actually harmless or inoffensive has a direct personal meaning
Peculiar, eccentric or unusual thinking, beliefs or mannerisms
Suspicious or paranoid thoughts and constant doubts about the loyalty of others
Belief in special powers, such as mental telepathy or superstitions
Unusual perceptions, such as sensing an absent person's presence or having illusions
Dressing in peculiar ways, such as appearing unkempt or wearing oddly matched clothes
Peculiar style of speech, such as vague or unusual patterns of speaking, or rambling oddly during conversations
complications: Temporary psychotic episodes, usually in response to stress
Work, school, relationship and social problems
diagnosis: Symptoms listed in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-5), published by the American Psychiatric Association

name: Meniere's disease
description: This chronic disorder affects balance and hearing, causing unpredictable episodes of dizziness and hearing problems.
symptoms: Feeling of fullness in the ear
diagnosis: Two or more vertigo attacks, each lasting 20 minutes to 12 hours, or up to 24 hours.
Hearing loss proved by a hearing test.
Tinnitus or a feeling of fullness or pressure in the ear.

name: Intestinal obstruction
description: A blocked intestine needs prompt medical care. Learn about symptoms and the wide range of causes for this serious but treatable digestive disorder.
symptoms: Crampy abdominal pain that comes and goes
Inability to have a bowel movement or pass gas
risks: Abdominal or pelvic surgery, which often causes adhesions — a common intestinal obstruction
Crohn's disease, which can cause the intestine's walls to thicken, narrowing the passageway

name: Familial Mediterranean fever
description: This genetic autoinflammatory disorder causes recurrent fevers and painful inflammation. Treatment can prevent attacks and complications.
symptoms: Chest pain, which can make it hard to breathe deeply
Painful, swollen joints, usually in the knees, ankles and hips
A red rash on your legs, especially below your knees
diagnosis: Review of your family medical history

name: Schwannoma
description: Learn about the diagnosis and treatment of this usually benign, slow-growing tumor that begins in peripheral nerve cells.

name: Meningioma
description: Meningioma is the most common type of tumor that forms in the head and may affect the brain. Find out about meningioma symptoms, diagnosis and treatment.
symptoms: Changes in vision, such as seeing double or blurriness
Headaches, especially those that are worse in the morning
Hearing loss or ringing in the ears
Weakness in your arms or legs
treatment: The size and location of the meningioma
The rate of growth or aggressiveness of the tumor

name: Familial adenomatous polyposis
description: This inherited condition leads to colon cancer. Treatment consists of having frequent screenings and having surgery to remove all or part of the colon.
complications: Congenital hypertrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium CHRPE
Low numbers of red blood cells anemia

name: Benign prostatic hyperplasia
description: Benign prostatic hyperplasia — also known as an enlarged prostate — is a common, but treatable urinary condition in older men.
symptoms: Frequent or urgent need to urinate
Increased frequency of urination at night (nocturia)
Weak urine stream or a stream that stops and starts
Dribbling at the end of urination
Inability to completely empty the bladder
complications: Sudden inability to urinate urinary retention

name: Spinal cord injury
description: Learn more about what happens after your spinal cord has been damaged.
risks: Being between the ages of 16 and 30

name: Meningitis
description: Spot the signs and understand the treatment options for meningitis, an infection that has several possible causes.
symptoms: Skin rash in some cases, such as in meningococcal meningitis.
preventions: If youre pregnant take care with food

name: Farsightedness
description: Do you see distant objects clearly, but develop a blur as they come close? This vision problem, called farsightedness, is easily corrected with prescription lenses.
symptoms: You need to squint to see clearly
You have eyestrain, including burning eyes, and aching in or around the eyes
You have general eye discomfort or a headache after doing close tasks, such as reading, writing, computer work or drawing, for a time

name: Brachial plexus injury
description: Learn about these nerve injuries that usually result from auto or motorcycle accidents and which procedures can help restore arm function.

name: Sciatica
description: Pressure on the sciatic nerve can cause pain and often numbness down a leg. Self-care measures might help.
complications: Loss of feeling in the affected leg
Loss of bowel or bladder control

name: Torn meniscus
description: Any activity that causes you to twist or rotate your knee, especially when putting your full weight on it, can cause this common knee injury.
symptoms: Pain, especially when twisting or rotating your knee
Feeling as though your knee is locked in place when you try to move it
Feeling of your knee giving way

name: Bradycardia
description: Find out more about the symptoms, diagnosis and treatment of a slower than typical heartbeat.
complications: Inability of the heart to pump enough blood (heart failure)
Sudden cardiac arrest or sudden death
preventions: Keep blood pressure and cholesterol under control
If you drink do so in moderation

name: Febrile seizure
description: These frightening but generally harmless seizures are triggered by a fever and affect infants and young children.
symptoms: Have a fever higher than 100.4 F (38.0 C)
Shake or jerk the arms and legs
treatment: Place your child on his or her side on a soft, flat surface where he or she won't fall.
Stay close to watch and comfort your child.
Remove hard or sharp objects near your child.
Don't restrain your child or interfere with your child's movements.
Don't put anything in your child's mouth.

name: Scleroderma
description: This group of rare diseases involves the hardening and tightening of the skin and connective tissues. Some forms can affect internal organs.

name: Menopause
description: Find out about this biological change and its long-term health implications — and learn how to manage bothersome hot flashes and other menopause symptoms.
causes: Surgery that removes the ovaries oophorectomy
complications: Heart and blood vessel cardiovascular disease
diagnosis: Follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) and estrogen (estradiol), because your FSH levels increase and estradiol levels decrease as menopause occurs
Thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH), because an underactive thyroid (hypothyroidism) can cause symptoms similar to those of menopause
treatment: Medications to prevent or treat osteoporosis

name: Sick sinus syndrome
description: This heart rhythm disorder causes slow, paused or irregular heartbeats. Learn the symptoms and how it's treated.
symptoms: A sensation of rapid, fluttering heartbeats (palpitations)
complications: Atrial fibrillation, a type of irregular heartbeat (arrhythmia)

name: Fecal incontinence
description: Learn about this common issue that causes some people to avoid social situations. Treatments are available.
causes: Loss of storage capacity in the rectum

name: Primary sclerosing cholangitis
description: Liver damage can result from this potentially serious disease in which scarring blocks the bile ducts. A liver transplant is the only known cure.

name: Menorrhagia
description: Learn about the causes and treatment of heavy menstrual periods.
symptoms: Soaking through one or more sanitary pads or tampons every hour for several consecutive hours
Needing to use double sanitary protection to control your menstrual flow
Needing to wake up to change sanitary protection during the night
Bleeding for longer than a week
Passing blood clots larger than a quarter
Restricting daily activities due to heavy menstrual flow
Symptoms of anemia, such as tiredness, fatigue or shortness of breath

name: Brain aneurysm
description: Learn about the signs and symptoms that may occur when a thinning wall of a blood vessel in your brain bulges — and know when to get emergency care.
risks: Narrow aorta coarctation of the aorta
complications: Narrowed blood vessels in the brain
A buildup of fluid within the brain hydrocephalus

name: Female infertility
description: Learn about infertility in women, including possible causes, what tests might be needed and fertility treatments available to help with getting pregnant.

name: Sclerosing mesenteritis
description: In sclerosing mesenteritis, tissue in the abdomen becomes inflamed and scarred. Learn about symptoms, diagnosis and treatment for this rare condition.
diagnosis: Removing a sample of tissue for testing biopsy

name: Menorrhagia
description: Learn about the causes and treatment of heavy menstrual periods.
symptoms: Soaking through one or more sanitary pads or tampons every hour for several consecutive hours
Needing to use double sanitary protection to control your menstrual flow
Needing to wake up to change sanitary protection during the night
Bleeding for longer than a week
Passing blood clots larger than a quarter
Restricting daily activities due to heavy menstrual flow
Symptoms of anemia, such as tiredness, fatigue or shortness of breath

name: Brain AVM
description: Tangled blood vessels in the brain interfere in this rare condition. Learn more.
symptoms: Headache or pain in one area of the head
Muscle weakness or numbness in one part of the body

name: Female sexual dysfunction
description: Learn more about female sexual difficulties — what causes them and possible treatments, including medications.
risks: Neurological conditions, such as spinal cord injury or multiple sclerosis
Gynecological conditions, such as vulvovaginal atrophy, infections or lichen sclerosus
Certain medications, such as antidepressants or high blood pressure medications
Emotional or psychological stress, especially with regard to your relationship with your partner
diagnosis: Discuss your sexual and medical history

name: Multiple sclerosis
description: This nervous system disorder causes a range of symptoms — and while there's no cure, it's possible to have long periods of remission.
complications: Severe weakness or paralysis, typically in the legs
Problems with bladder, bowel or sexual function
Cognitive problems, like forgetfulness or word finding difficulties
Mood problems, such as depression, anxiety or mood swings

name: Menstrual cramps
description: Menstrual cramps — pain in the lower abdomen just before or during menstrual periods — can range from mild to severe. Learn about treatment options.
symptoms: Throbbing or cramping pain in your lower abdomen that can be intense
Pain that starts 1 to 3 days before your period, peaks 24 hours after the onset of your period and subsides in 2 to 3 days
Pain that radiates to your lower back and thighs
risks: You started puberty early, at age 11 or younger
You have a family history of menstrual cramps (dysmenorrhea)

name: Brain AVM
description: Tangled blood vessels in the brain interfere in this rare condition. Learn more.
symptoms: Headache or pain in one area of the head
Muscle weakness or numbness in one part of the body

name: Fetal alcohol syndrome
description: Fetal alcohol syndrome results from alcohol exposure during the mother's pregnancy, causing irreversible brain damage and growth problems in the child.
causes: Alcohol enters your bloodstream and reaches your developing fetus by crossing the placenta
Alcohol causes higher blood alcohol concentrations in your developing baby than in your body because a fetus metabolizes alcohol slower than an adult does
Alcohol interferes with the delivery of oxygen and optimal nutrition to your developing baby
Exposure to alcohol before birth can harm the development of tissues and organs and cause permanent brain damage in your baby
risks: You think you might be pregnant
complications: Aggression, inappropriate social conduct, and breaking rules and laws
Mental health disorders, such as depression, anxiety or eating disorders
Problems staying in or completing school
Problems with independent living and with employment
Early death by accident, homicide or suicide
preventions: Dont drink alcohol if youre trying to get pregnant
Continue to avoid alcohol throughout your pregnancy
Consider giving up alcohol during your childbearing years
If you have an alcohol problem get help before you get pregnant
diagnosis: Watches for signs and symptoms of fetal alcohol syndrome in your childs initial weeks months and years of life

name: Scleroderma
description: This group of rare diseases involves the hardening and tightening of the skin and connective tissues. Some forms can affect internal organs.

name: General mental illness
description: A wide range of mental health conditions affect mood, thinking and behavior and can make you miserable and cause problems in daily life.
symptoms: Confused thinking or reduced ability to concentrate
Excessive fears or worries, or extreme feelings of guilt
Extreme mood changes of highs and lows
Significant tiredness, low energy or problems sleeping
Detachment from reality (delusions), paranoia or hallucinations
Inability to cope with daily problems or stress
Trouble understanding and relating to situations and to people
Problems with alcohol or drug use
risks: A history of mental illness in a blood relative, such as a parent or sibling
Stressful life situations, such as financial problems, a loved one's death or a divorce
An ongoing (chronic) medical condition, such as diabetes
Brain damage as a result of a serious injury (traumatic brain injury), such as a violent blow to the head
Traumatic experiences, such as military combat or assault
Use of alcohol or recreational drugs
A childhood history of abuse or neglect
Few friends or few healthy relationships
complications: Unhappiness and decreased enjoyment of life
Problems with tobacco, alcohol and other drugs
Missed work or school, or other problems related to work or school
Self-harm and harm to others, including suicide or homicide
Weakened immune system, so your body has a hard time resisting infections
Heart disease and other medical conditions
preventions: Get help when you need it

name: Brain metastasis
description: Learn about symptoms, diagnosis and treatment of cancers that spread to the brain (secondary, or metastatic, brain tumors).
symptoms: Headache, sometimes with vomiting or nausea
Mental changes, such as increasing memory problems
Weakness or numbness on one side of the body
diagnosis: Collecting and testing a sample of abnormal tissue biopsy

name: Fetal macrosomia
description: When a baby in utero grows much larger than average for gestational age, it can lead to complications during childbirth for both mother and baby.
treatment: Your baby weighs 11 pounds or more and you dont have a history of maternal diabetes
You delivered a baby whose shoulder got stuck behind your pelvic bone shoulder dystocia

name: Scoliosis
description: This sideways curvature of the spine occurs most often during the growth spurt just before puberty. Treatment may include braces or surgery.
symptoms: One shoulder blade that appears more prominent than the other
One hip higher than the other
One side of the rib cage jutting forward
A prominence on one side of the back when bending forward
causes: Certain neuromuscular conditions, such as cerebral palsy or muscular dystrophy
Birth defects affecting the development of the bones of the spine
Previous surgery on the chest wall as a baby
Injuries to or infections of the spine

name: Meralgia paresthetica
description: Meralgia paresthetica — Comprehensive overview covers symptoms, causes and treatments of this compressed nerve condition.
symptoms: Increased sensitivity and pain to even a light touch
causes: Tight clothing, such as belts, corsets and tight pants
Fluid accumulation in the abdomen causing increased abdominal pressure
Scar tissue near the inguinal ligament due to injury or past surgery
treatment: Gabapentin Gralise Neurontin phenytoin Dilantin or pregabalin Lyrica

name: Fever
description: Medications can lower a fever, but sometimes it's better left untreated. Fever may play a role in helping your body fight off infections.
causes: Certain inflammatory conditions such as rheumatoid arthritis — inflammation of the lining of your joints (synovium)
Some medications, such as antibiotics and drugs used to treat high blood pressure or seizures
Some immunizations, such as the diphtheria, tetanus and acellular pertussis (DTaP), pneumococcal or COVID vaccine
complications: Lay your child on the side or stomach on the floor or ground
Remove any sharp objects that are near your child
Hold your child to prevent injury
Don't place anything in your child's mouth or try to stop the seizure
Call 911 or your local emergency number if a seizure lasts more than five minutes or your child doesn't appear to recover well after the seizure
Get emergency room or urgent care services if it's your child's first febrile seizure.
preventions: Wash your hands often and teach your children to do the same
Show your children how to wash their hands thoroughly
Try to avoid touching your nose mouth or eyes
Cover your mouth when you cough and your nose when you sneeze
Avoid sharing cups water bottles and utensils
diagnosis: Ask questions about your symptoms and medical history
Take nasal or throat samples to test for respiratory infections
Order tests, such as blood tests or a chest X-ray, as needed, based on your medical history and physical exam

name: Brain tumor
description: Find out more about the different brain tumor types and treatments, including surgery, radiation therapy and chemotherapy.
symptoms: New onset or change in pattern of headaches
Headaches that gradually become more frequent and more severe
Vision problems, such as blurred vision, double vision or loss of peripheral vision
Gradual loss of sensation or movement in an arm or a leg
Seizures, especially in someone who doesn't have a history of seizures
diagnosis: Collecting and testing a sample of abnormal tissue biopsy

name: Scorpion stings
description: Learn more about symptoms, risk factors, treatment and prevention of this type of sting, which is painful but rarely life-threatening.
risks: Working hiking or camping where scorpions are

name: Merkel cell carcinoma
description: Learn about this aggressive skin cancer. Find out about symptoms, diagnosis and treatments, including Mohs surgery, radiation and immunotherapy.
risks: Excessive exposure to natural or artificial sunlight
preventions: Avoid the sun during peak hours
diagnosis: Removing a sample of suspicious skin

name: Cold sore
description: Learn more about  the causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention of this common lip sore caused by the herpes simplex virus type 1 (HSV-1).
causes: Hormonal changes, such as those related to menstruation
preventions: Avoid kissing and skin contact with people while blisters are present

name: Pediatric brain tumor
description: Pediatric brain tumors include medulloblastoma, glioma, embryonal tumor, germ cell brain tumor, spinal cord tumor, craniopharyngioma and pineoblastoma.
symptoms: Headaches, which may become more frequent and more severe
Feeling of increased pressure in the head
Abrupt onset of vision problems, such double vision
diagnosis: Tests to see if cancer has spread

name: Scrotal masses
description: Scrotal masses have many underlying causes. Even painless scrotal masses should be evaluated promptly by a doctor.
complications: Delayed or poor development during puberty

name: Mesenteric ischemia
description: Mesenteric ischemia can come on suddenly or develop over time. Find out more about this condition that restricts blood flow to the small intestine.

name: Valley fever
description: Learn about symptoms and treatment for valley fever — an infection caused by fungi found in the soil of America's desert regions.
preventions: Avoid very dusty areas, such as construction sites.
Wet the soil before digging in it, or avoiding soil if you're at higher risk of infection.
Keep doors and windows tightly closed.
Clean skin injuries with soap and water.

name: Mesenteric lymphadenitis
description: This painful condition, which involves inflamed lymph nodes in the membrane that connects your bowel to your abdominal wall, usually affects children and teens.
symptoms: Abdominal pain, often centered on the lower right side, but the pain can be more widespread

name: Seasonal affective disorder
description: This type of depression is related to changes in seasons and begins and ends at about the same times every year.
symptoms: Feeling listless, sad or down most of the day, nearly every day
Losing interest in activities you once enjoyed
Having low energy and feeling sluggish
Having problems with sleeping too much
Experiencing carbohydrate cravings, overeating and weight gain
Having thoughts of not wanting to live
risks: Having major depression or bipolar disorder
complications: Other mental health disorders such as anxiety or eating disorders

name: Breast cancer
description: Breast cancer — Comprehensive overview covers prevention, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment of breast cancer.
risks: A personal history of breast conditions
A personal history of breast cancer
A family history of breast cancer
Inherited genes that increase cancer risk
Beginning your period at a younger age
Beginning menopause at an older age
Having your first child at an older age

name: Viral hemorrhagic fevers
description: Learn more about the symptoms, treatment and prevention of these sometimes deadly diseases.
symptoms: Bleeding under the skin, in internal organs, or from the mouth, eyes or ears
risks: Sharing needles to use intravenous drugs
Working outdoors or in rat-infested buildings
Being exposed to infected blood or other body fluids

name: Mesothelioma
description: Learn about this uncommon cancer that's linked to asbestos exposure. Mesothelioma treatments include surgery, radiation and chemotherapy.
symptoms: Unusual lumps of tissue under the skin on your chest
complications: Pain caused by pressure on the nerves and spinal cord
Accumulation of fluid in the chest (pleural effusion), which can compress the lung nearby and make breathing difficult

name: Inflammatory breast cancer
description: Learn about this rare, aggressive type of breast cancer that causes a red, swollen breast. Treatments include surgery, radiation, chemotherapy and others.
symptoms: Rapid change in the appearance of one breast, over the course of several weeks
Thickness, heaviness or visible enlargement of one breast
Discoloration, giving the breast a red, purple, pink or bruised appearance
Unusual warmth of the affected breast
Dimpling or ridges on the skin of the affected breast, similar to an orange peel
Enlarged lymph nodes under the arm, above the collarbone or below the collarbone
Flattening or turning inward of the nipple

name: Hay fever
description: Find out more about how to diagnose and get relief from this common condition that can make you feel awful, seasonally and year-round.
symptoms: Itchy nose, roof of mouth or throat
Mucus that runs down the back of your throat (postnasal drip)
Swollen, bruised-appearing skin under the eyes (allergic shiners)
Extreme tiredness (fatigue), often due to poor sleep
risks: Having a condition called atopic dermatitis or eczema, which makes your skin irritated and itchy
Having a blood relative, such as a parent or sibling, with allergies or asthma
Living or working in an environment that constantly exposes you to allergens — such as animal dander or dust mites
Being exposed to smoke and strong odors that irritate the lining of the nose
Having a mother who smoked during your first year of life

name: Sebaceous carcinoma
description: Learn about diagnosis and treatments for this rare cancer that often affects the eyelid. Treatments include Mohs surgery and radiation.

name: Metabolic syndrome
description: Having three or more specific risk factors, such as high blood pressure or abdominal fat, boosts your risk of type 2 diabetes and heart disease.
preventions: Getting at least 30 minutes of physical activity most days
Eating plenty of vegetables, fruits, lean protein and whole grains
Limiting saturated fat and salt in your diet

name: Male breast cancer
description: Breast cancer can affect anyone, including men. Learn about the signs and symptoms of this cancer. Treatment most often involves surgery.
symptoms: A painless lump or thickening in your breast tissue
Changes to the skin covering your breast, such as dimpling, puckering, redness or scaling
Changes to your nipple, such as redness or scaling, or a nipple that begins to turn inward

name: Familial hypercholesterolemia
description: This inherited condition can cause extremely high levels of

name: Epidermoid cyst
description: Find out more about this usually harmless, common skin bump in adults.
symptoms: A small, round bump under the skin, usually on the face, neck or trunk
A tiny blackhead plugging the central opening of the cyst
A thick, yellow, smelly material that sometimes drains from the cyst
Redness, swelling and tenderness in the area, if inflamed or infected

name: Metachromatic leukodystrophy
description: This rare genetic disorder causes fatty substances (sulfatides) to build up in your brain and nervous system, causing progressive loss of nerve function.
symptoms: Loss of the ability to detect sensations, such as touch, pain, heat and sound
Loss of intellectual, thinking and memory skills
Loss of motor skills, such as walking, moving, speaking and swallowing
Stiff, rigid muscles, poor muscle function and paralysis
Loss of bladder and bowel function
Emotional and behavioral problems, including unstable emotions and substance misuse

name: Breast cysts and lumps
description: A firm, round lump in breast tissue could be a fluid-filled cyst. Typically not cancerous, breast cysts often need no treatment.
symptoms: A smooth, easily movable round or oval lump that may have smooth edges — which typically, though not always, indicates it's benign
Nipple discharge that may be clear, yellow, straw colored or dark brown
Breast pain or tenderness in the area of the breast lump
