Press on areas around your jaw to identify sites of pain or discomfort

name: Toxic hepatitis
description: Find out about symptoms and treatment for toxic hepatitis — liver inflammation caused by exposure to certain substances, such as alcohol or medications.
symptoms: Yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes (jaundice)
Abdominal pain in the upper right portion of the abdomen
risks: Taking overthecounter pain relievers or certain prescription drugs
preventions: Be cautious with herbs and supplements
Keep medications and chemicals away from children
treatment: Medication to reverse liver damage caused by acetaminophen

name: Cholera
description: Cholera is a treatable — yet potentially fatal — bacterial disease that causes diarrhea and dehydration. Learn how to lower your risk.
preventions: Wash your hands with soap and water frequently
Eat food thats completely cooked and hot
Stick to fruits and vegetables that you can peel yourself

name: TEN
description: Learn more about the causes, symptoms, treatment and risks of this life-threatening, rare skin disorder, also called toxic epidermal necrolysis.
symptoms: A spreading rash covering more than 30% of the body
Blisters and large areas of peeling skin
Sores, swelling and crusting on the mucous membranes, including the mouth, eyes and vagina

name: Hepatocellular carcinoma
description: Learn about innovative treatments for the most common type of liver cancer (hepatocellular carcinoma, or HCC), including liver transplant and ablation.

name: Pancreatic cancer
description: Pancreatic cancer — Overview covers symptoms, risk factors, prevention, diagnosis, surgery, chemotherapy and other treatment for cancer of the pancreas.
symptoms: Abdominal pain that radiates to your back
Loss of appetite or unintended weight loss
Yellowing of your skin and the whites of your eyes (jaundice)
New diagnosis of diabetes or existing diabetes that's becoming more difficult to control
risks: Family history of genetic syndromes that can increase cancer risk, including a BRCA2 gene mutation, Lynch syndrome and familial atypical mole-malignant melanoma (FAMMM) syndrome
Older age, as most people are diagnosed after age 65

name: Cholestasis of pregnancy
description: This liver condition can occur late in pregnancy, triggering intense itching. The risk of complications for your baby may require early delivery.
symptoms: Yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes, called jaundice
risks: Personal or family history of cholestasis of pregnancy
History of liver damage or disease, including hepatitis C and gallbladder stones
Pregnancy at an older age, such as 35 years or older
complications: Being born too early, also called preterm birth.

Lung problems from breathing in meconium. Meconium is the sticky, green substance that typically collects in the developing baby's intestines. Meconium may pass into the amniotic fluid if a mom has cholestasis.
Death of the baby late in pregnancy before delivery, also called stillbirth.
diagnosis: Ask questions about your symptoms and medical history
Order blood tests to measure the level of bile acids in your blood and to check how well your liver is working

name: Tendinitis
description: Repetitive activities and weekend warrior exercise can bother tendons, causing pain and swelling.
symptoms: Pain, often described as a dull ache, especially when moving the hurt limb or joint

name: Enlarged liver
description: Having a larger than normal liver is a sign of a serious problem, such as liver disease, congestive heart failure or cancer.
symptoms: Yellowing of the skin and the whites of the eyes (jaundice)
risks: Large doses of medicines vitamins or supplements
preventions: Drink alcohol in moderation if at all
Follow directions when taking medications vitamins or supplements

name: Pancreatic cyst
description: Most pancreatic cysts are benign, but some types are cancerous. Find out about symptoms, causes and treatment of cysts in the pancreas.
symptoms: Persistent abdominal pain, which may radiate to your back
Feeling full soon after you start eating

name: Achilles tendinitis
description: Achilles tendinitis — Comprehensive overview covers symptoms, causes, treatment of this overuse injury.

name: Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor
description: Learn about these cancers that start in the hormone-producing cells of the pancreas. Explore innovative treatments, including the Whipple procedure and PRRT.
symptoms: Pain in your abdomen or back
Yellowing of your skin or eyes
risks: A family history of pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors

name: Patellar tendinitis
description: Jumper's knee — a common knee injury — affects the tendon that stretches from the kneecap (patella) to the shinbone.

name: Pancreatitis
description: Pancreatitis can occur suddenly or build up over time. Learn about symptoms, causes and treatment of this potentially serious digestive system disorder.
symptoms: Abdominal pain that radiates to your back
causes: High triglyceride levels in the blood (hypertriglyceridemia)
High calcium levels in the blood (hypercalcemia), which may be caused by an overactive parathyroid gland (hyperparathyroidism)

name: Tennis elbow
description: Tennis elbow — Painful condition is caused by repetitive motions of the wrist and arm. Non-athletes are also affected. Learn how to prevent and treat it.
symptoms: Shake hands or grip an object
causes: Cutting up cooking ingredients, particularly meat

name: Panic attacks
description: Learn about effective treatment for sudden episodes of intense fear that trigger severe physical reactions when there is no real danger or apparent cause.
symptoms: Sense of impending doom or danger
Fear of loss of control or death
Shortness of breath or tightness in your throat
causes: Temperament that is more sensitive to stress or prone to negative emotions
Certain changes in the way parts of your brain function
risks: Family history of panic attacks or panic disorder
Major life stress, such as the death or serious illness of a loved one
A traumatic event, such as sexual assault or a serious accident
Major changes in your life, such as a divorce or the addition of a baby
History of childhood physical or sexual abuse
complications: Development of specific phobias, such as fear of driving or leaving your home
Frequent medical care for health concerns and other medical conditions
Depression, anxiety disorders and other psychiatric disorders
Increased risk of suicide or suicidal thoughts
diagnosis: Blood tests to check your thyroid and other possible conditions and tests on your heart, such as an electrocardiogram (ECG or EKG)
A psychological evaluation to talk about your symptoms, fears or concerns, stressful situations, relationship problems, situations you may be avoiding, and family history
treatment: Serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors SNRIs

name: Chondrosarcoma
description: Learn about this rare type of cancer that primarily affects bone, particularly in the shoulders, hips and pelvis. Treatment usually involves surgery.
symptoms: A growing lump or area of swelling
Weakness or bowel and bladder control problems, if the cancer presses on the spinal cord
diagnosis: Removing a sample of tissue for testing biopsy

name: de Quervain's tenosynovitis
description: This painful condition affects the tendons on the thumb side of the wrist. A splint or brace can rest the tendons. Ice also is helpful.
symptoms: Pain near the base of the thumb
Swelling near the base of the thumb
Difficulty moving the thumb and wrist when doing something that involves grasping or pinching
A "sticking" or "stop-and-go" sensation in the thumb when moving it
risks: Jobs or hobbies that involve repetitive hand and wrist motions

name: Hepatopulmonary syndrome
description: This lung condition causes low oxygen levels and shortness of breath in people who have advanced liver disease.
symptoms: Shortness of breath, especially when sitting or standing
Clubbing of the fingers, in which the fingertips spread out and become rounder than normal
Broken blood vessels under the skin (spider angioma)
Bluish tinge of the lips and skin (cyanosis)

name: Tension headache
description: These common headaches are commonly triggered by stress and may be managed through a regimen of healthy habits and medications.
symptoms: Sensation of tightness or pressure across the forehead or on the sides and back of the head
Tenderness in the scalp, neck and shoulder muscles

name: Hemochromatosis
description: This liver disorder causes your body to absorb too much iron from the foods you eat. Learn about symptoms, causes and treatment for this condition that usually runs in families.
risks: Having two copies of an altered HFE gene

name: Partial anomalous pulmonary venous return
description: In this heart problem present at birth, some of the blood vessels of the lungs connect to the wrong places in the heart. Learn when treatment is needed.

name: Retractile testicle
description: Find out about this condition that allows the testicle to move between the scrotum and groin.
symptoms: The testicle may be moved by hand from the groin into the scrotum and won't immediately retreat to the groin.
The testicle might spontaneously appear in the scrotum and remain there for a time.
The testicle might spontaneously disappear again for a time.

name: Chordoma
description: Find out about this rare type of bone cancer. Learn about innovative chordoma treatments, including minimally invasive surgery and proton therapy.

name: Hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia
description: This inherited blood vessel disorder can cause severe nosebleeds, strokes, bleeding in the digestive tract and anemia.
symptoms: Nosebleeds, sometimes on a daily basis and often starting in childhood
Lacy red vessels or tiny red spots, particularly on the lips, face, fingertips, tongue and inside surfaces of the mouth
treatment: Drugs that block blood vessel growth
Drugs that slow the disintegration of clots

name: Undescended testicle
description: Learn about causes, complications and treatment of this condition in which one or both testicles aren't in their normal place within the scrotum.
risks: Family history of undescended testicles or other problems of genital development
Conditions of the fetus that can restrict growth, such as Down syndrome or an abdominal wall defect
Alcohol use by the mother during pregnancy
Cigarette smoking by the mother or exposure to secondhand smoke

name: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease
description: Learn how to spot the symptoms and how doctors treat this group of peripheral nerve disorders.
symptoms: Weakness in your legs, ankles and feet
Loss of muscle bulk in your legs and feet
Difficulty lifting your foot at the ankle (footdrop)
Awkward or higher than normal step (gait)
Decreased sensation or a loss of feeling in your legs and feet
diagnosis: Signs of muscle weakness in your arms, legs, hands and feet
Decreased muscle bulk in your lower legs, resulting in an inverted champagne bottle appearance
Sensory loss in your feet and hands
Foot deformities, such as high arches or hammertoes
Other orthopedic problems, such as mild scoliosis or hip dysplasia

name: Huntington's disease
description: This condition causes a progressive breakdown of nerve cells in the brain. Find out about what signs to watch for and how treatments may help.
complications: Complications related to the inability to swallow

name: Paraganglioma
description: Learn about this rare tumor that begins in nerve cells and sometimes causes high blood pressure. It's usually benign but sometimes spreads.
diagnosis: Tests to look for excess hormones
Procedures to remove a sample of cells for testing biopsy

name: Testicular cancer
description: Learn about cancer that starts in the testicles. Treatments include surgery, chemotherapy and radiation therapy.
risks: Having an undescended testicle which is called cryptorchidism
Having a family history of testicular cancer

name: Lynch syndrome
description: Learn about this condition caused by inherited genes that increase the risk of colon cancer, endometrial cancer and other kinds of cancer.
symptoms: Cancer of the inside lining of the uterus (endometrial cancer) before age 50
A personal history of more than one type of cancer
A family history of cancer before age 50

A family history of other cancers caused by Lynch syndrome, including stomach cancer, ovarian cancer, pancreatic cancer, kidney cancer, bladder cancer, ureteral cancer, brain cancer, small intestine cancer, gallbladder cancer, bile duct cancer and skin cancer

name: Testicular torsion
description: Sudden, severe pain in the scrotum could be testicular torsion. Learn about symptoms and treatment for this health emergency.
symptoms: Sudden, severe pain in the scrotum — the loose bag of skin under your penis that contains the testicles
A testicle that's positioned higher than normal or at an unusual angle
complications: Damage to or death of the testicle

name: Paraneoplastic syndromes of the nervous system
description: This group of uncommon disorders affects people who have cancer, and occurs when parts of the immune system attack parts of the nervous system.
symptoms: Loss of muscle tone or weakness
Loss of fine motor skills, such as picking up objects
Memory loss and other thinking (cognitive) impairment

name: Stickler syndrome
description: This genetic disorder can cause serious vision, hearing and joint problems. Children may be born with a cleft palate and distinctive facial features.

name: Choroid plexus carcinoma
description: This rare type of cancerous brain tumor occurs mainly in children under 2. Treatment usually involves surgery and radiation therapy.
diagnosis: Collecting and testing a sample of abnormal tissue biopsy

name: Male hypogonadism
description: This condition affects the ability of men's bodies to produce enough testosterone or enough sperm or both.

name: Paraneoplastic syndromes of the nervous system
description: This group of uncommon disorders affects people who have cancer, and occurs when parts of the immune system attack parts of the nervous system.
symptoms: Loss of muscle tone or weakness
Loss of fine motor skills, such as picking up objects
Memory loss and other thinking (cognitive) impairment

name: Hiatal hernia
description: A hiatal hernia occurs when part of the stomach bulges into the chest. It can cause severe heartburn but is treatable.
symptoms: Regurgitation of food or liquids into the mouth
Backflow of stomach acid into the esophagus (acid reflux)
Feeling full soon after you eat
Vomiting of blood or passing of black stools, which may indicate gastrointestinal bleeding
causes: Injury to the area, for example, after trauma or certain types of surgery
Being born with an unusually large hiatus
Persistent and intense pressure on the surrounding muscles, such as while coughing, vomiting, straining during a bowel movement, exercising or lifting heavy objects
treatment: Medications that block acid production and heal the esophagus

name: Addison's disease
description: Learn about this rare but serious disorder of the adrenal glands that's treated by replacing needed hormones.
symptoms: Weight loss and loss of appetite
Low blood sugar, also called hypoglycemia
Body hair loss or sexual issues in some people
preventions: Talk to your health care provider if you always feel tired or weak or are losing weight without trying. Ask about an adrenal shortage.
If you have been diagnosed with Addison's disease, ask your provider what to do when you're sick. You may need to learn how to increase your dose of corticosteroids.
If you become very sick, especially if you are vomiting and you can't take your medicine, go to an emergency room.
treatment: Hydrocortisone Cortef prednisone Rayos or methylprednisolone Medrol

name: Tetanus
description: Learn about treatment of the serious bacterial infection commonly known as lockjaw and the vaccines that prevent it.
symptoms: Painful muscle spasms and stiff, immovable muscles (muscle rigidity) in your jaw
Tension of muscles around your lips, sometimes producing a persistent grin
Painful spasms and rigidity in your neck muscles
risks: Cuts or wounds exposed to soil or manure
A foreign body in a wound, such as a nail or splinter
A history of immune-suppressing medical conditions
Infected skin lesions in people living with diabetes
An infected umbilical cord when a mother isn't fully vaccinated
Shared and unsanitary needles for illegal drug use
complications: Blockage of a lung artery pulmonary embolism

name: Paraneoplastic syndromes of the nervous system
description: This group of uncommon disorders affects people who have cancer, and occurs when parts of the immune system attack parts of the nervous system.
symptoms: Loss of muscle tone or weakness
Loss of fine motor skills, such as picking up objects
Memory loss and other thinking (cognitive) impairment

name: Inguinal hernia
description: What happens if part of the intestine bulges through a weak spot in abdominal muscle? This condition can be painful and often requires surgery to fix.
symptoms: A bulge in the area on either side of your pubic bone, which becomes more obvious when you're upright, especially if you cough or strain
A burning or aching sensation at the bulge
Pain or discomfort in your groin, especially when bending over, coughing or lifting
A heavy or dragging sensation in your groin
Weakness or pressure in your groin
Occasionally, pain and swelling around the testicles when the protruding intestine descends into the scrotum
causes: A preexisting weak spot in the abdominal wall
Straining during bowel movements or urination
risks: Premature birth and low birth weight
Previous inguinal hernia or hernia repair
preventions: Lift heavy objects carefully or avoid heavy lifting

name: Tetralogy of Fallot
description: Learn more about a rare condition caused by a combination of four heart defects that are present at birth (congenital).
symptoms: A bluish coloration of the skin caused by low blood oxygen levels (cyanosis)
Shortness of breath and rapid breathing, especially during feeding or exercise
Tiring easily during play or exercise
An abnormal, rounded shape of the nail bed in the fingers and toes (clubbing)
causes: Narrowing of the lung valve pulmonary valve stenosis
A hole between the bottom heart chambers ventricular septal defect
Shifting of the bodys main artery aorta
Thickening of the right lower heart chamber right ventricular hypertrophy
risks: A viral illness during pregnancy, such as rubella (German measles)
A parent who has tetralogy of Fallot
The presence of Down syndrome or DiGeorge syndrome in the baby
complications: Leaking pulmonary valve (chronic pulmonary regurgitation), in which blood leaks through the valve back into the pumping chamber (right ventricle)
Holes in the wall between the ventricles (ventricular septal defects) that may continue to leak after repair or may need re-repair
Enlarged right ventricle or left ventricle that isn't working properly
Enlargement of the ascending aorta (aortic root dilation)

name: Umbilical hernia
description: Learn about this condition in which your intestines create a bulge near your navel.
causes: Long-term peritoneal dialysis to treat kidney failure
treatment: Are slightly larger than 1/4 to 3/4 inch (1 to 2 centimeters) in diameter
Are large and don't decrease in size over the first two years of life
Become trapped or block the intestine

name: Transient global amnesia
description: When your memory suddenly disappears, it can be frightening — but transient global amnesia is typically temporary and harmless.
symptoms: Sudden onset of confusion that includes memory loss, seen by a witness
Being awake and alert and knowing who you are, despite memory loss
Normal cognition, such as the ability to recognize and name familiar objects and follow simple directions
No signs of damage to a particular area of the brain, such as being unable to move an arm or leg, movements you can't control, or problems understanding words
causes: Sudden immersion in cold or hot water
Medical procedures, such as angiography or endoscopy
Being emotionally upset, perhaps by bad news, conflict or overwork

name: Herniated disk
description: This condition occurs most often in the lower back. In many cases, it causes no symptoms and requires no treatment. Surgery is rarely needed.

name: Thalassemia
description: Some forms of this inherited blood disorder usually show up before the age of 2, often causing anemia. More severe forms of the disease require regular blood transfusions.

name: Parkinson's disease
description: There's no cure for this progressive movement disorder, but treatments can help significantly improve your symptoms.
treatment: Adenosine receptor antagonists A2A receptor antagonist

name: Parotid gland tumor
description: Learn about symptoms and diagnosis of parotid gland tumors. Find out how operations, such as parotidectomy, can treat parotid tumors and parotid cancers.
diagnosis: Collecting of a sample of tissue for testing biopsy

name: Chronic exertional compartment syndrome
description: Learn about this condition that causes pain and swelling in muscles of the legs or arms during exercise.
symptoms: Aching, burning or cramping pain in a compartment of the affected limb
Numbness or tingling in the affected limb
Foot drop, in severe cases, if legs are affected
Occasionally, swelling or bulging as a result of a muscle hernia

name: Thoracic aortic aneurysm
description: Learn about this serious condition in which the upper part of the body's main artery becomes weak and may rupture.
symptoms: Tenderness or pain in the chest
risks: Buildup of plaques in the arteries
complications: Lifethreatening bleeding inside the body internal bleeding
preventions: Don't smoke or use tobacco products.
Keep blood pressure and cholesterol levels under control.
Reduce cholesterol and fat in the diet.

name: Partial anomalous pulmonary venous return
description: In this heart problem present at birth, some of the blood vessels of the lungs connect to the wrong places in the heart. Learn when treatment is needed.

name: Chronic cough
description: A cough that lasts for weeks could be caused by smoking, postnasal drip, asthma, acid reflux, respiratory infections, COPD or another underlying problem.
symptoms: A feeling of liquid running down the back of your throat (postnasal drip)
Frequent throat clearing and sore throat
Heartburn or a sour taste in your mouth
In rare cases, coughing up blood

name: Thoracic outlet syndrome
description: This group of disorders causes symptoms including pain or numbness due to pressure on the blood vessels or nerves between the collarbone and rib.

name: Chronic daily headache
description: If you have a headache most days, you might have one of the most disabling headache conditions, chronic daily headaches. Aggressive treatment and long-term management might help.
causes: Inflammation or other problems with the blood vessels in and around the brain, including stroke
Intracranial pressure that's either too high or too low

name: Rubella
description: Learn more about the symptoms and prevention of this contagious viral infection best known for its distinctive red rash.
symptoms: Mild fever of 102 F (38.9 C) or lower
Enlarged, tender lymph nodes at the base of the skull, the back of the neck and behind the ears
A fine, pink rash that begins on the face and quickly spreads to the trunk and then the arms and legs, before disappearing in the same order
Aching joints, especially in young women
complications: Problems with the development of the heart (congenital heart defects)
Problems with the development of other organs
Problems with mental development and learning

name: Partial anomalous pulmonary venous return
description: In this heart problem present at birth, some of the blood vessels of the lungs connect to the wrong places in the heart. Learn when treatment is needed.

name: Chronic exertional compartment syndrome
description: Learn about this condition that causes pain and swelling in muscles of the legs or arms during exercise.
symptoms: Aching, burning or cramping pain in a compartment of the affected limb
Numbness or tingling in the affected limb
Foot drop, in severe cases, if legs are affected
Occasionally, swelling or bulging as a result of a muscle hernia

name: Parvovirus infection
description: Learn more about the symptoms, causes, treatment and prevention of this common childhood infection — sometimes called slapped-cheek disease.

name: Throat cancer
description: Learn more about this type of cancer that affects your throat (pharynx), voice box (larynx) or tonsils.
symptoms: Changes in your voice, such as hoarseness or not speaking clearly
A lump or sore that doesn't heal
preventions: Stop smoking or dont start smoking
Drink alcohol only in moderation if at all
Choose a healthy diet full of fruits and vegetables
diagnosis: Using a scope to get a closer look at your throat
Removing a tissue sample for testing

name: Chronic fatigue syndrome
description: This complicated disorder may be triggered by an infection. While there's no cure for chronic fatigue syndrome, treatment focuses on easing symptoms.
symptoms: Extreme exhaustion after physical or mental exercise.
Problems with memory or thinking skills.
Dizziness that worsens with moving from lying down or sitting to standing.

name: Patellar tendinitis
description: Jumper's knee — a common knee injury — affects the tendon that stretches from the kneecap (patella) to the shinbone.

name: Buerger's disease
description: Read about this blood vessel disease that limits blood flow, especially to your hands and feet. Quitting smoking is the best treatment for this condition.
symptoms: Tingling or numbness in the hands or feet.
Pale, reddish or blue-tinted hands or feet.

Pain that may come and go in your legs and feet or in your arms and hands. This pain may occur when you use your hands or feet and eases when you stop that activity (claudication), or when you're at rest.
Inflammation along a vein just below the skin's surface (due to a blood clot in the vein).
Fingers and toes that turn pale when exposed to cold (Raynaud's phenomenon).
Painful open sores on your fingers and toes.

name: Patellofemoral pain syndrome
description: Patellofemoral pain syndrome — Comprehensive overview covers symptoms, treatment of this knee condition common among runners.
symptoms: Sit with a bent knee for long periods of time

name: Thrombocytopenia
description: Thrombocytopenia — Comprehensive overview covers symptoms, causes, treatment of a low platelet count.
diagnosis: Physical exam including a complete medical history

name: Patent ductus arteriosus
description: Learn about symptoms, causes and treatment of this common — and treatable — heart problem that occurs shortly after birth.
symptoms: Poor eating, which leads to poor growth.
risks: Family history and other genetic conditions
Being born at a high altitude
complications: High blood pressure in the lungs also called pulmonary hypertension
preventions: Seek early prenatal care even before youre pregnant

name: Thrombocytosis
description: This condition occurs when your body produces too many platelets, the cells that help blood clot. Thrombocytosis can cause clotting or bleeding problems.
symptoms: Burning pain in the hands or feet.

name: Patent foramen ovale
description: Learn more about the causes and complications of this condition in which a hole in the heart doesn't close the way it should after birth.

name: Thrombophlebitis
description: Learn more about this inflammation of a blood vessel that can interrupt flow.
symptoms: Warmth, tenderness and pain in the affected area
causes: Being immobile for long periods, such as during an injury or a hospital stay
risks: Are inactive for a prolonged period, either because you're confined to bed or you're traveling in a car or plane for a long period
Have varicose veins, which are a common cause of superficial thrombophlebitis
Have a pacemaker or have a thin, flexible tube (catheter) in a central vein, for treatment of a medical condition, which may irritate the blood vessel wall and decrease blood flow
Are pregnant or have just given birth
Use birth control pills or hormone replacement therapy, which can make your blood more likely to clot
Have a family history of a blood-clotting disorder or a tendency to form blood clots
Have had previous episodes of thrombophlebitis

name: Chronic granulomatous disease
description: Learn about this inherited disease usually diagnosed in childhood that makes it difficult for your body to fight infections.
symptoms: Chest pain when inhaling or exhaling
Skin irritation that may include a rash, swelling or redness
Swelling and redness in your mouth
Gastrointestinal problems that may include vomiting, diarrhea, stomach pain, bloody stool or a painful pocket of pus near the anus

name: Compulsive gambling
description: Also called gambling disorder, compulsive gambling is the uncontrollable urge to keep gambling despite the toll it takes on your life.
symptoms: Being preoccupied with gambling, such as constantly planning gambling activities and how to get more gambling money
Needing to gamble with increasing amounts of money to get the same thrill
Trying to control, cut back or stop gambling, without success
Feeling restless or irritable when you try to cut down on gambling
Gambling to escape problems or relieve feelings of helplessness, guilt, anxiety or depression
Trying to get back lost money by gambling more (chasing losses)
Lying to family members or others to hide the extent of your gambling
Risking or losing important relationships, a job, or school or work opportunities because of gambling
Asking others to bail you out of financial trouble because you gambled money away
risks: Medications used to treat Parkinsons disease and restless legs syndrome
complications: Poor work performance or job loss
Suicide, suicide attempts or suicidal thoughts
diagnosis: Ask questions related to your gambling habits

name: Oral thrush
description: Oral thrush is a fungal infection caused by the overgrowth of Candida albicans, which causes creamy white lesions on the tongue and lining of your mouth.
preventions: Brush your teeth at least twice a day and floss daily
Maintain good blood sugar control if you have diabetes

name: Chronic hives
description: Learn how this long-lasting skin condition that causes painful, itchy, recurring welts is diagnosed and what treatments may offer relief.
symptoms: Batches of welts (wheals) that can arise anywhere on the body
Welts that might be red, purple or skin-colored, depending on your skin color
Welts that vary in size, change shape, and appear and fade repeatedly
Painful swelling (angioedema) around the eyes, cheeks or lips
Flares triggered by heat, exercise or stress
Symptoms that persist for more than six weeks and recur often and anytime, sometimes for months or years
causes: Vibration, such as caused by jogging or using lawnmowers
Pressure on the skin, as from a tight waistband
Medical conditions, such as thyroid disease, infection, allergy and cancer
diagnosis: Any medications, herbal remedies or supplements you take
Where hives appear and how long it takes a welt to fade and whether it leaves behind a bruise or other mark
Whether your hives come with painful swelling

name: Pseudobulbar affect
description: Pseudobulbar affect — Overview covers symptoms, treatment of this neurological condition that's characterized by uncontrollable laughing and crying.
treatment: Dextromethorphan hydrobromide and quinidine sulfate Nuedexta

name: Thumb arthritis
description: This common condition can cause pain and mobility issues, making simple tasks difficult. Treatment may include medications, splints and sometimes surgery.
symptoms: Swelling, stiffness and tenderness at the base of your thumb
Decreased strength when pinching or grasping objects
Enlarged or bony appearance of the joint at the base of your thumb
risks: Certain hereditary conditions, such as joint ligament laxity and malformed joints.
Injuries to your thumb joint, such as fractures and sprains.

Diseases that change the normal structure and function of cartilage, such as rheumatoid arthritis. Although osteoarthritis is the most common cause of thumb arthritis, rheumatoid arthritis can also affect the CMC joint, usually to a lesser extent than other joints of the hand.
Activities and jobs that put high stress on the thumb joint.

name: Chronic kidney disease
description: Learn about kidney failure symptoms, tests, diagnosis and treatment options, including medication, dialysis and kidney transplant.
symptoms: High blood pressure (hypertension) that's difficult to control
Shortness of breath, if fluid builds up in the lungs
Chest pain, if fluid builds up around the lining of the heart
risks: Being Black, Native American or Asian American
Frequent use of medications that can damage the kidneys
complications: Fluid retention, which could lead to swelling in your arms and legs, high blood pressure, or fluid in your lungs (pulmonary edema)
A sudden rise in potassium levels in your blood (hyperkalemia), which could impair your heart's function and can be life-threatening
Weak bones and an increased risk of bone fractures
Decreased sex drive, erectile dysfunction or reduced fertility
Damage to your central nervous system, which can cause difficulty concentrating, personality changes or seizures
Decreased immune response, which makes you more vulnerable to infection
Pericarditis, an inflammation of the saclike membrane that envelops your heart (pericardium)
Pregnancy complications that carry risks for the mother and the developing fetus
Irreversible damage to your kidneys (end-stage kidney disease), eventually requiring either dialysis or a kidney transplant for survival
preventions: Manage your medical conditions with your doctors help

name: Kleptomania
description: If you have this impulse control disorder, you can't resist urges to steal items that you generally don't really need and that usually have little value.
symptoms: Inability to resist powerful urges to steal items that you don't need
Feeling increased tension, anxiety or arousal leading up to the theft
Feeling pleasure, relief or satisfaction while stealing
Feeling terrible guilt, remorse, self-loathing, shame or fear of arrest after the theft
Return of the urges and a repetition of the kleptomania cycle
causes: Problems with a naturally occurring brain chemical called serotonin
complications: Other impulse-control disorders, such as compulsive gambling or shopping
diagnosis: Ask questions about your impulses and how they make you feel
Review a list of situations to ask if these situations trigger your kleptomania episodes
Discuss problems you have had because of this behavior
Have you fill out questionnaires or self-assessments
Use the guidelines in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-5), published by the American Psychiatric Association

name: Thunderclap headache
description: These headaches are sudden and severe, and can warn of a life-threatening condition — so seek immediate medical attention.
symptoms: Can be accompanied by nausea or vomiting
causes: Bleeding between the brain and membranes covering the brain (subarachnoid hemorrhage)
A rupture of a blood vessel in the brain
A tear in the lining of an artery that supplies blood to the brain
Leaking of cerebrospinal fluid — usually due to a tear of the covering around a nerve root in the spine
Death of tissue or bleeding in the pituitary gland
A blood clot in the brain
Severe elevation in blood pressure (hypertensive crisis)
Infection such as meningitis or encephalitis

name: Chronic kidney disease
description: Learn about kidney failure symptoms, tests, diagnosis and treatment options, including medication, dialysis and kidney transplant.
symptoms: High blood pressure (hypertension) that's difficult to control
Shortness of breath, if fluid builds up in the lungs
Chest pain, if fluid builds up around the lining of the heart
risks: Being Black, Native American or Asian American
Frequent use of medications that can damage the kidneys
complications: Fluid retention, which could lead to swelling in your arms and legs, high blood pressure, or fluid in your lungs (pulmonary edema)
A sudden rise in potassium levels in your blood (hyperkalemia), which could impair your heart's function and can be life-threatening
Weak bones and an increased risk of bone fractures
Decreased sex drive, erectile dysfunction or reduced fertility
Damage to your central nervous system, which can cause difficulty concentrating, personality changes or seizures
Decreased immune response, which makes you more vulnerable to infection
Pericarditis, an inflammation of the saclike membrane that envelops your heart (pericardium)
Pregnancy complications that carry risks for the mother and the developing fetus
Irreversible damage to your kidneys (end-stage kidney disease), eventually requiring either dialysis or a kidney transplant for survival
preventions: Manage your medical conditions with your doctors help

name: Pseudobulbar affect
description: Pseudobulbar affect — Overview covers symptoms, treatment of this neurological condition that's characterized by uncontrollable laughing and crying.
treatment: Dextromethorphan hydrobromide and quinidine sulfate Nuedexta

name: Chronic lymphocytic leukemia
description: Learn about this cancer that forms in white blood cells called lymphocytes. Treatments include chemotherapy, targeted therapy and immunotherapy.
symptoms: Pain in the upper left portion of the abdomen, which may be caused by an enlarged spleen
risks: Family history of blood and bone marrow cancers
A condition that causes excess lymphocytes
complications: A switch to a more aggressive form of cancer

name: Polycystic ovary syndrome
description: Polycystic ovaries, hormone imbalance and irregular periods are telltale signs and symptoms of polycystic ovary syndrome. Find out about treatments.
complications: Gestational diabetes or pregnancy-induced high blood pressure
Nonalcoholic steatohepatitis — a severe liver inflammation caused by fat buildup in the liver

Metabolic syndrome — a cluster of conditions including high blood pressure, high blood sugar, and unhealthy cholesterol or triglyceride levels that significantly increase your risk of heart and blood vessel (cardiovascular) disease
Cancer of the uterine lining (endometrial cancer)

name: Hashimoto's disease
description: Learn about the symptoms and treatment of this thyroid disorder caused by an immune-system dysfunction.
causes: Environmental triggers, such as infection, stress or radiation exposure
Interactions between environmental and genetic factors

name: Chronic myelogenous leukemia
description: Learn about chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML) symptoms and causes. Find out how doctors treat CML, including targeted therapy and bone marrow transplant.
symptoms: Feeling full after eating a small amount of food
Pain or fullness below the ribs on the left side
risks: Radiation exposure, such as radiation therapy for certain types of cancer

name: COPD
description: This chronic inflammatory lung disease causes obstructed airflow from the lungs, resulting in breathing difficulty, cough, mucus production and wheezing.
symptoms: Shortness of breath, especially during physical activities
A chronic cough that may produce mucus (sputum) that may be clear, white, yellow or greenish
Swelling in ankles, feet or legs
risks: Occupational exposure to dusts and chemicals
Exposure to fumes from burning fuel
complications: High blood pressure in lung arteries
preventions: Quit smoking to help reduce your risk of heart disease and lung cancer.
Get an annual flu vaccination and regular vaccination against pneumococcal pneumonia to reduce your risk of or prevent some infections.
Talk to your doctor if you feel sad or helpless or think that you may be experiencing depression.

name: Chronic pelvic pain
description: Chronic pelvic pain can be a symptom of another disease or a condition in its own right. Learn how this painful condition is diagnosed and treated.
symptoms: Pressure or heaviness deep within your pelvis

name: Chronic kidney disease
description: Learn about kidney failure symptoms, tests, diagnosis and treatment options, including medication, dialysis and kidney transplant.
symptoms: High blood pressure (hypertension) that's difficult to control
Shortness of breath, if fluid builds up in the lungs
Chest pain, if fluid builds up around the lining of the heart
risks: Being Black, Native American or Asian American
Frequent use of medications that can damage the kidneys
complications: Fluid retention, which could lead to swelling in your arms and legs, high blood pressure, or fluid in your lungs (pulmonary edema)
A sudden rise in potassium levels in your blood (hyperkalemia), which could impair your heart's function and can be life-threatening
Weak bones and an increased risk of bone fractures
Decreased sex drive, erectile dysfunction or reduced fertility
Damage to your central nervous system, which can cause difficulty concentrating, personality changes or seizures
Decreased immune response, which makes you more vulnerable to infection
Pericarditis, an inflammation of the saclike membrane that envelops your heart (pericardium)
Pregnancy complications that carry risks for the mother and the developing fetus
Irreversible damage to your kidneys (end-stage kidney disease), eventually requiring either dialysis or a kidney transplant for survival
preventions: Manage your medical conditions with your doctors help

name: Chronic sinusitis
description: Read more about possible causes of lasting sinus troubles, what treatments are available and how you can prevent this problem in the future.
symptoms: Thick, discolored discharge from the nose (runny nose)
Drainage down the back of the throat (postnasal drainage)
Blocked or stuffy (congested) nose causing difficulty breathing through your nose
Pain, tenderness and swelling around your eyes, cheeks, nose or forehead
Reduced sense of smell and taste
risks: An immune system disorder such as HIV/AIDS or cystic fibrosis
Hay fever or another allergic condition
Regular exposure to pollutants such as cigarette smoke
preventions: Avoid cigarette smoke and polluted air
diagnosis: Samples from your nasal and sinus discharge cultures
treatment: Medication to treat nasal polyps and chronic sinusitis

name: Chronic traumatic encephalopathy
description: This type of brain degeneration is likely caused by recurrent concussions, but what causes the damage isn't well understood.

name: Vulvodynia
description: If you have pain, burning or irritation in your vaginal area, talk to your doctor. You could have vulvodynia.
causes: Injury to or irritation of the nerves surrounding your vulvar region
Muscle spasm or weakness in the pelvic floor, which supports the uterus, bladder and bowel

name: Churg-Strauss syndrome
description: This rare blood vessel disease may cause breathing trouble, face pain and a persistent runny nose. Medications can help.
symptoms: Loss of appetite and weight loss
Weakness, fatigue or a general feeling of being unwell
Pain, numbness, and tingling in your hands and feet

name: Cirrhosis
description: Cirrhosis is an advanced stage of scarring and damage of the liver. Find out about symptoms and treatment of this life-threatening liver condition.
causes: Chronic viral hepatitis (hepatitis B, C and D)
Fat accumulating in the liver (nonalcoholic fatty liver disease)
Copper accumulated in the liver (Wilson's disease)
Inherited disorders of sugar metabolism (galactosemia or glycogen storage disease)
Liver disease caused by your body's immune system (autoimmune hepatitis)
Destruction of the bile ducts (primary biliary cirrhosis)
Hardening and scarring of the bile ducts (primary sclerosing cholangitis
Infection, such as syphilis or brucellosis
complications: High blood pressure in the veins that supply the liver portal hypertension
Swelling in the legs and abdomen
Buildup of toxins in the brain hepatic encephalopathy
preventions: Do not drink alcohol if you have cirrhosis

name: Creutzfeldt Jakob disease
description: Learn what can put someone at risk of developing this rare brain disorder that causes dementia.

name: Chronic kidney disease
description: Learn about kidney failure symptoms, tests, diagnosis and treatment options, including medication, dialysis and kidney transplant.
symptoms: High blood pressure (hypertension) that's difficult to control
Shortness of breath, if fluid builds up in the lungs
Chest pain, if fluid builds up around the lining of the heart
risks: Being Black, Native American or Asian American
Frequent use of medications that can damage the kidneys
complications: Fluid retention, which could lead to swelling in your arms and legs, high blood pressure, or fluid in your lungs (pulmonary edema)
A sudden rise in potassium levels in your blood (hyperkalemia), which could impair your heart's function and can be life-threatening
Weak bones and an increased risk of bone fractures
Decreased sex drive, erectile dysfunction or reduced fertility
Damage to your central nervous system, which can cause difficulty concentrating, personality changes or seizures
Decreased immune response, which makes you more vulnerable to infection
Pericarditis, an inflammation of the saclike membrane that envelops your heart (pericardium)
Pregnancy complications that carry risks for the mother and the developing fetus
Irreversible damage to your kidneys (end-stage kidney disease), eventually requiring either dialysis or a kidney transplant for survival
preventions: Manage your medical conditions with your doctors help

name: Claudication
description: Too little blood flow to the legs and arms can cause pain, especially during exercise. Learn more about diagnosing and treating intermittent claudication.
symptoms: Pain, ache, discomfort or fatigue in muscles every time those muscles are used
Pain in the calves, thighs, buttocks, hips or feet
Less often, pain in shoulders, biceps and forearms
Pain that gets better soon after resting
risks: A family history of atherosclerosis, peripheral artery disease or claudication
Age older than 50 years if you also smoke or have diabetes
Obesity (a body mass index, or BMI, over 30)
complications: Death of muscle and skin tissues (gangrene)
preventions: If you have diabetes, keep your blood sugar in good control
Quit smoking if you're a smoker

name: Cleft palate
description: Surgery can fix openings or splits in the upper lip, or the roof of the mouth (palate), or both types of these birth defects.
symptoms: A split in the lip and roof of the mouth (palate) that affects one or both sides of the face
A split in the lip that appears as only a small notch in the lip or extends from the lip through the upper gum and palate into the bottom of the nose
A split in the roof of the mouth that doesn't affect the appearance of the face
risks: Exposure to certain substances during pregnancy
complications: Challenges of coping with a medical condition
treatment: Feeding strategies, such as using a special bottle nipple or feeder
Speech therapy to correct difficulty with speaking
Orthodontic adjustments to the teeth and bite, such as having braces
Monitoring by a pediatric dentist for tooth development and oral health from an early age
Monitoring and treatment for ear infections, which may include ear tubes
Hearing aids or other assistive devices for a child with hearing loss
Therapy with a psychologist to help the child cope with the stress of repeated medical procedures or other concerns

name: Mitral valve prolapse
description: This heart condition, also called Barlow syndrome, affects the valve separating the left heart chambers. Know the symptoms and when it’s treated.
symptoms: Difficulty breathing or shortness of breath, especially during exercise or when lying flat

name: Depression
description: Depression is a mood disorder that causes a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest and can interfere with your daily functioning.
symptoms: Feelings of sadness, tearfulness, emptiness or hopelessness
Angry outbursts, irritability or frustration, even over small matters
Loss of interest or pleasure in most or all normal activities, such as sex, hobbies or sports
Sleep disturbances, including insomnia or sleeping too much
Tiredness and lack of energy, so even small tasks take extra effort
Reduced appetite and weight loss or increased cravings for food and weight gain
Slowed thinking, speaking or body movements
Feelings of worthlessness or guilt, fixating on past failures or self-blame
Trouble thinking, concentrating, making decisions and remembering things
Frequent or recurrent thoughts of death, suicidal thoughts, suicide attempts or suicide
Unexplained physical problems, such as back pain or headaches
risks: Certain personality traits, such as low self-esteem and being too dependent, self-critical or pessimistic
Traumatic or stressful events, such as physical or sexual abuse, the death or loss of a loved one, a difficult relationship, or financial problems
Blood relatives with a history of depression, bipolar disorder, alcoholism or suicide
Being lesbian, gay, bisexual or transgender, or having variations in the development of genital organs that aren't clearly male or female (intersex) in an unsupportive situation
History of other mental health disorders, such as anxiety disorder, eating disorders or post-traumatic stress disorder
Abuse of alcohol or recreational drugs
Serious or chronic illness, including cancer, stroke, chronic pain or heart disease
Certain medications, such as some high blood pressure medications or sleeping pills (talk to your doctor before stopping any medication)
complications: Excess weight or obesity, which can lead to heart disease and diabetes
Anxiety, panic disorder or social phobia
Family conflicts, relationship difficulties, and work or school problems
Suicidal feelings, suicide attempts or suicide
preventions: Reach out to family and friends
Get treatment at the earliest sign of a problem

name: Chronic lymphocytic leukemia
description: Learn about this cancer that forms in white blood cells called lymphocytes. Treatments include chemotherapy, targeted therapy and immunotherapy.
symptoms: Pain in the upper left portion of the abdomen, which may be caused by an enlarged spleen
risks: Family history of blood and bone marrow cancers
A condition that causes excess lymphocytes
complications: A switch to a more aggressive form of cancer

name: C. difficile infection
description: Learn more about this diarrhea-causing infection that often occurs after antibiotic use. Many, but not all, affected people are in health care facilities.
complications: A hole in your large intestine bowel perforation
diagnosis: Other signs and symptoms of C. difficile infection
Presence of C. difficile in a stool sample
treatment: Are taking other antibiotics for a different condition while being treated with antibiotics for C. difficile infection
Have a severe underlying medical disorder, such as chronic kidney failure, inflammatory bowel disease or chronic liver disease

name: C. difficile infection
description: Learn more about this diarrhea-causing infection that often occurs after antibiotic use. Many, but not all, affected people are in health care facilities.
complications: A hole in your large intestine bowel perforation
diagnosis: Other signs and symptoms of C. difficile infection
Presence of C. difficile in a stool sample
treatment: Are taking other antibiotics for a different condition while being treated with antibiotics for C. difficile infection
Have a severe underlying medical disorder, such as chronic kidney failure, inflammatory bowel disease or chronic liver disease

name: Clubfoot
description: This term describes a range of congenital foot abnormalities in which the foot is twisted out of shape or position, keeping it from moving up and down.
symptoms: The top of the foot is usually twisted downward and inward, increasing the arch and turning the heel inward.
The foot may be turned so severely that it actually looks as if it's upside down.
The affected leg or foot may be slightly shorter.
The calf muscles in the affected leg are usually underdeveloped.
risks: Not enough amniotic fluid during pregnancy
preventions: Not smoking or spending time in smoky environments
Avoiding drugs not approved by your doctor

name: Cluster headache
description: These painful headaches cause severe pain on one side of the head and tend to occur in frequent bouts called cluster periods.

name: Coarctation of the aorta
description: Learn more about the causes and treatment of this usually congenital heart condition that is treatable but requires lifelong follow-up.
risks: Holes in the wall between the left and right sides of the heart
complications: A weakened or bulging artery in the brain (brain aneurysm)
Enlargement in part of the aorta's wall (aneurysm)
Premature narrowing of the blood vessels that supply the heart (coronary artery disease)
diagnosis: High blood pressure in the arms
A difference in blood pressure between the arms and legs — blood pressure in the legs is lower than blood pressure in the arms
A weak or delayed pulse in the legs
A whooshing sound caused by faster blood flow through the narrowed artery (heart murmur)

name: Valley fever
description: Learn about symptoms and treatment for valley fever — an infection caused by fungi found in the soil of America's desert regions.
preventions: Avoid very dusty areas, such as construction sites.
Wet the soil before digging in it, or avoiding soil if you're at higher risk of infection.
Keep doors and windows tightly closed.
Clean skin injuries with soap and water.

name: Cold urticaria
description: Learn more about the symptoms and treatment of this allergic skin reaction caused by cold that most often affects young adults.
symptoms: Temporary itchy welts (hives) on the area of skin that was exposed to cold
A worsening of the reaction as the skin warms
Swelling of hands while holding cold objects
Swelling of lips from consuming cold food or drink
risks: You have an underlying health condition
preventions: Take an over-the-counter antihistamine before cold exposure.
Protect your skin from the cold or sudden changes in temperature. If you're going swimming, dip your hand in the water first and see if you experience a skin reaction.
Avoid ice-cold drinks and food to prevent swelling of your throat.
If your doctor prescribed an epinephrine autoinjector (EpiPen, Auvi-Q, others), keep it with you to help prevent serious reactions.
If you're scheduled for surgery, talk with your surgeon beforehand about your cold urticaria. The surgical team can take steps to help prevent cold-induced symptoms in the operating room.

name: Hypothermia
description: Learn about symptoms, treatment and prevention of hypothermia — a life-threatening condition in which the body loses heat faster than it can generate it.
causes: Wearing clothes that aren't warm enough for weather conditions
Staying out in the cold too long
Being unable to get out of wet clothes or move to a warm, dry location
Falling into the water, as in a boating accident
Living in a house that's too cold, either from poor heating or too much air conditioning
complications: Decay and death of tissue resulting from an interruption in blood flow (gangrene)

name: Cold sore
description: Learn more about  the causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention of this common lip sore caused by the herpes simplex virus type 1 (HSV-1).
causes: Hormonal changes, such as those related to menstruation
preventions: Avoid kissing and skin contact with people while blisters are present

name: Cold urticaria
description: Learn more about the symptoms and treatment of this allergic skin reaction caused by cold that most often affects young adults.
symptoms: Temporary itchy welts (hives) on the area of skin that was exposed to cold
A worsening of the reaction as the skin warms
Swelling of hands while holding cold objects
Swelling of lips from consuming cold food or drink
risks: You have an underlying health condition
preventions: Take an over-the-counter antihistamine before cold exposure.
Protect your skin from the cold or sudden changes in temperature. If you're going swimming, dip your hand in the water first and see if you experience a skin reaction.
Avoid ice-cold drinks and food to prevent swelling of your throat.
If your doctor prescribed an epinephrine autoinjector (EpiPen, Auvi-Q, others), keep it with you to help prevent serious reactions.
If you're scheduled for surgery, talk with your surgeon beforehand about your cold urticaria. The surgical team can take steps to help prevent cold-induced symptoms in the operating room.

name: Common cold
description: A viral infection of your nose and throat can include signs and symptoms such as a stuffy nose, sore throat, cough and low-grade fever.
symptoms: Slight body aches or a mild headache
preventions: Stay away from people with colds
Review your child care centers policies

name: Colic
description: Consoling a baby who cries a lot for no apparent reason is a challenge. Learn strategies for caring for your infant and coping with the stress.
symptoms: Intense crying that may seem more like screaming or an expression of pain
Crying for no apparent reason, unlike crying to express hunger or the need for a diaper change
Extreme fussiness even after crying has diminished
Predictable timing, with episodes often occurring in the evening
Facial discoloring, such as skin flushing or blushing
Body tension, such as pulled up or stiffened legs, stiffened arms, clenched fists, arched back, or tense abdomen
causes: Digestive system that isn't fully developed
Imbalance of healthy bacteria in the digestive tract
complications: Increased risk of postpartum depression in mothers
Feelings of guilt, exhaustion, helplessness or anger
diagnosis: Measuring your baby's height, weight and head circumference
Listening to the heart, lungs and abdominal sounds
Examining the limbs, fingers, toes, eyes, ears and genitals
Assessing reaction to touch or movement
Looking for signs of rash, inflammation, or other signs of infection or allergies
